0.title: 21-year-old MBBS student found hanging at her residence in Chandigarh
0.article_body: A 21-year-old MBBS student of Government Medical College and Hospital was found hanging at her residence in Chandigarh's Sector 22, police said. "The incident came to light when her mother visited her...She knocked...didn't receive any response," police added. "The mother said her daughter was scheduled to go to college for taking admission in current semester...she was nervous," police stated.

1.title: Made us proud: Akshay after R Madhavan's son Vedaant wins Gold at Danish Open
1.article_body: After actor R Madhavan's son Vedaant Madhavan bagged a gold medal in swimming at the Danish Open 2022, several actors including Akshay Kumar and Priyanka Chopra took to Twitter to congratulate him. Akshay wrote, "These young boys Sajan and Vedaant have made us...proud. I'm sure it's an amazing feeling as a parent." Priyanka tweeted, "Congratulations Vedaant! That's an amazing feat!"

2.title: Centre notifies merger of 3 municipal corporations in Delhi into 1
2.article_body: The Central government has notified the Delhi Municipal Corporation (Amendment) Act, 2022, merging Delhi's East, South, and North Delhi Municipal Corporations into one. The corporation will be known as the 'Municipal Corporation of Delhi'. The government will also appoint a special officer to discharge functions of the corporation, until the date on which the corporation's first meeting is held.

3.title: 2 students fall off moving bus' footboard in TN; video surfaces
3.article_body: A video of two students falling off a moving bus while they tried to hold onto the vehicle in Tamil Nadu's Tenkasi has surfaced online. Locals reportedly rushed the students, who suffered minor injuries after falling off the bus' footboard, to the hospital following the incident. The bus conductor claimed that the students had been trying to perform stunts.

4.title: Parents thrash groom's family after daughter elopes for marriage in Chandigarh
4.article_body: The parents of a woman, who eloped with a man for marriage in Chandigarh, allegedly thrashed the groom's family on Monday. The complainant, Rahul, said the woman's parents and their aides attacked him, his sisters and his parents after his elder brother got married to their daughter against their wish. Rahul suffered fractures in both the legs and arms.

5.title: I knew in my mind I had to take wickets to change game: Chahal on hat-trick
5.article_body: RR spinner Yuzvendra Chahal said he knew he had to take wickets in the 17th over against KKR to change the momentum of the game. Chasing RR's 218-run target, KKR were 178/4 after 16 overs when Chahal came and picked four wickets, including a hat-trick. "Would've been happy with a dot ball as well on my hat-trick ball," added Chahal.

6.title: Vishal Bhardwaj praises 'desi food' at Priyanka's NYC restaurant, she reacts
6.article_body: Filmmaker Vishal Bhardwaj took to Twitter to share a picture from Priyanka Chopra's Indian restaurant Sona, located in New York, US. "What a lovely night with friends and the most delicious desi food with a twist in NY. #SonaNewYork," he wrote. Priyanka reacted to Vishal's post and wrote, "So glad you liked it, sir. You're welcome anytime."

7.title: We shot with 100+ dogs, it was really challenging: Arun Vijay on 'Oh My Dog'
7.article_body: While talking about 'Oh My Dog', actor Arun Vijay said it was "really challenging" to work with so many dogs at same time. "I think we shot with nearly 100+ dogs...Having said that...they seemed to have way more fun than...entire cast and crew...Hats off to Raja, the trainer...and our director Sarov to ensure that everything went on smoothly," he added.

8.title: My male friends tell me 'your mom is quite hot': Shweta Tiwari's daughter Palak
8.article_body: Shweta Tiwari's daughter Palak Tiwari, in an interview, was asked if her male friends have ever told her that they have a crush on her mother. "They've not said...they've a crush on her, they're like 'Your mom is quite hot'," Palak said, adding, "I was like 'you say this and...my mom is gonna belo (beat with rolling pin) like that'."

9.title: Bengaluru records 51 new COVID-19 cases, positivity rate at 2.91%
9.article_body: Bengaluru on Monday reported 51 new COVID-19 cases and zero deaths, according to data published by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP). With 39 new recoveries, the active cases in the city now stand at 1,403. According to official data, the daily COVID-19 positivity rate in Bengaluru increased to 2.91% as compared to 1.48% reported on Sunday.

10.title: US drops mask mandate on trains, airplanes after court order
10.article_body: The US government ended the mask mandate for people using public transportation such as trains and airplanes. This comes after a federal judge in Florida declared the 14-month-old directive unlawful. Following the court order, major airlines such as American Airlines, United Airlines and Delta Air Lines lifted the mask mandate. The national train line Amtrak also relaxed the restrictions.

11.title: Delhi's law & order is under Centre: Sharad Pawar on Jahangirpuri violence
11.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Monday reacted to the violence in Delhi’s Jahangirpuri during a Hanuman Jayanti procession, saying that Delhi's law and order situation comes under the Central government. Pawar added, "We never heard of communal violence during Ram Navami. The reason behind this is the BJP and some of their organisation."

12.title: Haryana to grant same scholarship to general and SC players
12.article_body: Haryana government has decided to grant the same scholarship to general and SC category players. "To boost players across all categories, we have made scholarship in the general category at par with SC category players except for the ₹18,000 for participation to SC players and ₹1,000 extra for female medallists from the state," said Pankaj Nain, Director Sports, Haryana.

13.title: Ranbir holds note saying 'I pledge ₹12 lakh to all bridesmaids' during wedding; pic viral
13.article_body: A picture of Ranbir Kapoor holding a note saying 'I, Ranbir, husband of Alia, pledge ₹12 lakh to all the bridesmaids' during his wedding has gone viral. Alia Bhatt's friend Tanya Saha Gupta shared pictures from the wedding, writing, "It's sappy days like these that I live for." Alia and Ranbir got married on April 14.

14.title: CoinDCX doubles valuation to $2.15 bn, becomes India's most valuable crypto company
14.article_body: CoinDCX has raised $135.9 million in a funding round led by Pantera Capital and Steadview Capital. This led to its valuation being doubled to $2.15 billion in eight months to become the most valued cryptocurrency trading platform in India. CoinDCX plans to use its fund to increase its employees from 400 to 1000 by the end of next year.

15.title: Man in blue kurta seen opening fire during violence in Delhi's Jahangirpuri arrested
15.article_body: Delhi Police have arrested 28-year-old Imam alias Sonu, who was seen in a video purportedly firing a gun during the violence at Jahangirpuri. DCP (Northwest) Usha Rangnani said, "A video was being circulated on social media showing a man in blue kurta opening fire during the riot in Jahangirpuri area."  A sophisticated pistol was recovered from his possession, police said.

16.title: Suspended principal of Mohali institute held for demanding ₹50,000 bribe
16.article_body: The vigilance bureau on Monday arrested a suspended principal of the Industrial Training Institute (Women), Phase 5, Mohali, for allegedly demanding a bribe of ₹50,000 from a Ludhiana resident for helping him land an instructor’s job in the institute. The accused man, Shamsher Singh Purkhalvi, was suspended two weeks ago following a slew of complaints against him.

17.title: Girl whose pic with contact details on her back went viral escapes Ukraine war
17.article_body: A girl whose picture with contact details written on her back went viral has escaped Ukraine war along with her mother. The girl's mother Makoviy wrote the details on her back in case they were separated in the war. Makoviy confirmed that she and Vira escaped Ukraine and have been living in a French village with her mother.

18.title: US to no longer conduct anti-satellite tests, first nation to do so
18.article_body: The US has announced that it will no longer conduct anti-satellite (ASAT) missile tests, becoming the first nation to make such a declaration. Vice President Kamala Harris, who chairs the National Space Council, made the announcement. "This commitment addresses one of the most pressing threats to...security...of space, as demonstrated by Russia's...ASAT missile test," the White House said.

19.title: Karnataka govt takes 30% commission on grants reserved for mutts: Seer
19.article_body: A Lingayat seer, Dingaleshwara Swami of Balehosur Mutt, claimed that the Basavaraj Bommai-led Karnataka government takes a 30% commission on grants reserved for the welfare of mutts. "The corruption has reached this level...officials say they cannot be released until commission is paid," the seer added. "For cities like Delhi...funds are like ice creams...we get only ice cream sticks," he stated.

20.title: Ukraine shifting stance, inconsistent during peace talks: Russia
20.article_body: Russia said that Ukraine is "changing its position" on issues previously agreed upon at talks between the two sides and "the trend of the negotiating process leaves much to be desired". "The Ukrainian side isn't consistent in terms of the points that have been agreed," Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov said. However, Peskov said that "contacts continue at an expert level".

21.title: Fearing blackmail over obscene pics, Maha doctor hires people to beat nurse
21.article_body: A doctor and two other accused, who he hired to beat and steal mobile phone of a female nurse, have been arrested by the Ulhasnagar Police. The doctor had doubts about nurse having some obscene pictures of him and thought that she would blackmail him. Police said he gave other accused ₹10,000 to attack the nurse.

22.title: Power crisis in Maharashtra due to mismanagement of MVA govt: BJP leader
22.article_body: BJP leader Girish Mahajan alleged that power crisis in Maharashtra was caused due to "mismanagement" of the MVA government and the previous Devendra Fadnavis-led government ensured the state did not face load-shedding even for a day. "An artificial power shortage is being created, then electricity is bought at higher rates to earn commission, cuts," the BJP leader added.

23.title: Restored hope in justice system: SKM as SC cancels Ashish Mishra's bail
23.article_body: Samyukt Kisan Morcha (SKM) on Monday said that Supreme Court has "restored hope in the justice system" by cancelling Union Minister Ajay Mishra Teni's son Ashish Mishra's bail in the Lakhimpur Kheri violence case. SMK added that now Teni should be "sacked from the post of minister", failing which it'll hold a national meeting and announce a nationwide protest programme.

24.title: Hong Kong disposing over 2,000 tonnes of plastic waste daily amid COVID-19
24.article_body: Amid COVID-19, Hong Kong has been disposing over 2,300 tonnes of plastic waste a day, revealed government data. An entrepreneur while speaking from a quarantine hotel in the city said that all staff members wore PPE kits and items like phones, and remotes are cellophane wrapped. Meanwhile, a government spokesperson said officials were aware of the surge in disposable waste.

25.title: Chahal and Buttler's performances were there for the world to see: Samson
25.article_body: Speaking at the post-match ceremony after their 7-run win against KKR, RR captain Sanju Samson said, "Yuzvendra Chahal and Jos Buttler's performances were there for the world to see." He added, "Halfway, I thought [our total] was chaseable. KKR played very well...but the wickets helped." Chahal took a hat-trick in his five-wicket haul while Buttler scored 103(61) in the game.

26.title: Umran Malik scares you the same way Jofra Archer does: Ian Bishop
26.article_body: Former West Indies pacer Ian Bishop said SRH pacer Umran Malik's bowling is as scary as that of England fast bowler Jofra Archer and New Zealand pacer Lockie Ferguson. "It is just fascinating to me what Umran can become," added Bishop. "He's bowling with hostility which means even the best of batters will be uncomfortable facing him," stated Bishop.

27.title: Dejected parties taking refuge in vote bank, divisive politics: Nadda
27.article_body: Reacting to Opposition parties' joint statement criticising Centre over incidents of communal violence, BJP President JP Nadda said, Opposition is "casting aspersions on our hardworking citizens". Unfortunately, this thrust towards development politics is being bitterly resisted by "rejected and dejected parties" which are "once again taking refuge in vote bank and divisive politics", he added.

28.title: 6 killed, several injured as bus crashes into SUV in Uttar Pradesh's Deoria
28.article_body: Six people died and several others were left injured after a collision between an SUV and a bus in Uttar Pradesh's Deoria on Monday late night. The incident took place when the SUV carrying passengers was returning from a Tilak ceremony. "The bus came from the opposite direction and rammed into the vehicle," Deoria Superintendent of Police Shripati Mishra said.

29.title: Police lathi-charge PHE daily wage workers during protest in J&K
29.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir police on Monday lathi-charged some Public Health Engineering (PHE) daily wage workers during their protest for regularisation and release of pending wages in Jammu. The protesters were intercepted by police while they were marching towards Raj Bhawan. "BJP government has betrayed us and if they fail to fulfil our demands...then we'll stop supplying water," a protester said.

30.title: Yemen's Houthi rebels agree to stop using child soldiers: UN
30.article_body: Yemen's Houthi rebels have agreed to stop using child soldiers in armed conflicts, the United Nations has said. A UN official said that the rebels agreed to identify and release children from their ranks within six months. The action plan, which the UN said Houthis signed, also calls for preventing violence against children and attacks on hospitals and schools.

31.title: He only plays 5 or 10 balls every match: Malinga on Riyan Parag's form
31.article_body: Talking about RR batter Riyan Parag, their fast-bowling coach Lasith Malinga said there's no concern over the 20-year-old's form. "He hasn't got much chance...he just plays five or 10 balls every match," stated Malinga. Parag was dismissed for 5 off 3 balls against KKR on Monday and has scored a total of 48 runs in six games so far.

32.title: Ashwin's running celebration after dismissing Russell for golden duck goes viral
32.article_body: Rajasthan Royals (RR) all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin's running celebration after dismissing Andre Russell for a golden duck with a carrom ball has gone viral. After Russell got clean bowled, Ashwin was seen running with both his hands pointing towards him. Ashwin registered figures of 4-0-38-1 in the match, which RR won by seven runs.

33.title: Shreyas Iyer shouts angrily at Venkatesh Iyer for refusing double, video goes viral
33.article_body: A video of KKR captain Shreyas Iyer shouting angrily at Venkatesh Iyer for refusing to run a double on the last ball of their 16th over against RR has gone viral. Shreyas was also seen staring at Venkatesh. Venkatesh got stumped out on the first delivery of the 17th over bowled by Yuzvendra Chahal.

34.title: RR's Prasidh Krishna and KKR's Aaron Finch involved in verbal fight, video goes viral
34.article_body: RR pacer Prasidh Krishna and KKR opener Aaron Finch were involved in a verbal exchange after the latter got out in their IPL 2022 match on Monday. Krishna was seen giving Finch a send-off after which the Australian said something to him. Finch was dismissed for 58(28) on last ball of KKR's ninth over. Krishna registered bowling figures of 4-0-43-1.

35.title: PM Modi to inaugurate India's 1st Semicon Conference on April 29 in B'luru
35.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will inaugurate the first 'Semicon India 2022 Conference' in Bengaluru on April 29. The three-day event will be organised around the theme - Design and Manufacture in India for the World: Making India a "Semiconductor Nation". According to MoS (Electronics and IT) Rajeev Chandrasekhar, the government is looking forward to sign several MoUs during the event.

36.title: India records 1,247 new COVID-19 cases, 1 death; active cases at 11,860
36.article_body: India has reported 1,247 new COVID-19 cases and one death in the last 24 hours, according to the Union Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. It comes a day after the country saw 2,183 cases and 214 deaths. Active COVID-19 cases in India stand at 11,860, while the death toll has risen to 5,21,966.

37.title: Maybe we missed something in script: Prabhas on Radhe Shyam's performance
37.article_body: Prabhas, speaking about the underwhelming performance of his latest film 'Radhe Shyam' at the box office, said, "Maybe COVID or maybe we missed something in script." "Maybe people don't want to watch me in that zone, even if they want to watch - maybe they expect me to be too good," said Prabhas, who played a palmist in 'Radhe Shyam'.

38.title: Wore loose clothes to hide baby bump; now I'm open about it: Sonam on pregnancy
38.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor revealed that she tried to hide her baby bump at the beginning of her pregnancy. "I was trying to hide it because it was like a situation where I am still." "Now I am...being more open about it, but first I was trying to hide it, so I was wearing all these loose clothes," she added.

39.title: Talks with Putin stalled over mass killings in Ukraine: Macron
39.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron said that his talks with Russian President Vladimir Putin over the Ukraine war have stalled. "Since the massacres we have discovered in Bucha and in other towns, the war has taken a different turn, so I did not speak to him again directly since, but I don't rule out doing so in the future", Macron said.

40.title: 11 held after stone-pelting incident on Hanuman Jayanti in Uttarakhand's Haridwar
40.article_body: Police on Monday booked 13 people and arrested 11 in connection with an alleged stone-pelting incident in Bhagwanpur area of Uttarakhand's Haridwar during a Hanuman Jayanti procession. The incident allegedly occurred when the procession was crossing a Muslim-dominated stretch in Danda Jalalpur village, police said. "Sufficient force is present in the village...situation is peaceful," police added.

41.title: Biggest risk of cryptocurrency will be money laundering, terror financing: Sitharaman
41.article_body: The biggest risk of cryptocurrency would be money laundering and its use for financing terror, said Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman. "I think regulation using technology is the only answer. Regulation using technology will have to be so adept, that it has to be not behind the curve, but be sure that it is on the top of it," she added.

42.title: Adheera is a bigger character: Sanjay on comparison between Adheera & Kancha
42.article_body: Sanjay Dutt spoke about his character 'Adheera' which has been compared with his portrayal of 'Kancha Cheena' in the 2012 film 'Agneepath', also starring actors Hrithik Roshan and Priyanka Chopra. He said, "The motive is...same. 'Kancha' wanted 'Mandwa', 'Adheera' wants 'KGF'. But the character, look and feel are different." "Adheera is a bigger character in his own right," he added.

43.title: Woman consumes poison outside venue of Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's event
43.article_body: A woman on Monday allegedly consumed a poisonous substance outside the venue where Bihar CM Nitish Kumar holds 'Janta Darbar' programme, a police officer said. According to Patna SSP Manavjit Singh Dhillon, the woman is facing some marital problems and her husband is in jail. She was taken to a hospital and is now out of danger, police added.

44.title: Delhi court asks ASI not to remove Ganesha idols from Qutub complex
44.article_body: A Delhi court has directed the Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) not to remove two Lord Ganesha idols called 'Ulta Ganesh' and 'Ganesha in cage', from the Qutub Minar complex till further directions. Last month, National Monuments Authority wrote a letter to ASI stating that the Ganesha idols should either be removed or given a "respectable" place in Qutub complex.

45.title: Felt wrong about being in dad's film, told him 'I cannot do this': Vivek Oberoi
45.article_body: Actor Vivek Oberoi said that it felt wrong for him to be a part of the film that his father Suresh Oberoi offered him. "My father didn't come with a sifaarish ki chitthi. He came to this incredibly difficult industry with his own merit...So, I took this critical decision and told him I cannot do this [the film]," Vivek said.

46.title: NamasteyNFT to host Web3-based exhibition event in Bengaluru
46.article_body: NamasteyNFT, a group that claims to support artists and creators, will host a two-day event to be held at Bangalore International Exhibition Centre from May 14 to 15. "The event will witness a confluence of artists, developers and collectors from Web3," said NamasteyNFT spokesperson. The event is expected to have workshops on Web3, cyber security and wallet safety.

47.title: Pakistan startup Abhi raises funds at $90 million valuation
47.article_body: Pakistani financial platform Abhi has raised $17 million in a Series A funding round led by Speedinvest at a valuation of $90 million. Global Ventures, VentureSouq, VEF, Sturgeon Capital, Rallycap, FJ Labs, Fatima Gobi, Sarmayacar and i2i Ventures also participated in the funding round. Pakistani startups raised over $350 million last year.

48.title: Cannabis worth ₹2.33 cr seized from truck in Andhra’s Anakapalle
48.article_body: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) seized 1169.3 kg of cannabis worth about ₹2.33 crore from Andhra Pradesh’s Anakapalle district. A substantial quantity of cannabis was being transported via a truck from Anakapalle towards Hyderabad via Vijayawada, as per DRI's press release. "DRI found the truck in an accident-met and abandoned condition in a trench," the release stated.

49.title: Restoration work of Pune's Shivaji Market likely to begin in May
49.article_body: The restoration work of the Chhatrapati Shivaji Market in Pune is likely to begin in the third week of May. The renovation of the market, which comes under the Pune Cantonment Board, was delayed due to a lack of funds at the board. Notably, the reconstruction was necessitated due to the fire breaking out in the market in March 2021.

50.title: UP govt mandates prior permission for taking out religious processions
50.article_body: Following incidents of communal violence across the country during Ram Navami and Hanuman Jayanti, the Uttar Pradesh government has mandated prior permission for taking out religious processions across the state. CM Yogi Adityanath said organisers have to produce an affidavit ensuring peace and harmony before seeking permission. "Permission shouldn't be given to any new processions," he added.

51.title: Zepto starts 10-min snacks delivery in Mumbai, CEO clarifies 'Not delivering food'
51.article_body: Zepto has started a 10-minute delivery of snacks in Mumbai. It has collaborated with restaurants such as Blue Tokai Coffee and Chaayos for the delivery of items like tea, coffee, and croissants, among others. Meanwhile, Aadit Palicha, CEO of Zepto clarified that they are not delivering food but only ready-to-drink coffee, tea, and packaged snacks.

52.title: Delhi sees most heatwave days in April since 2010, max temp at 41.6°C
52.article_body: Delhi on Monday recorded the seventh heatwave day so far in April 2022 and the highest for the month since 2010. Safdarjung observatory on Monday recorded a maximum temperature of 41.6°C, five degrees above normal. The national capital is likely to witness the eighth heatwave day on Tuesday, as per IMD. Notably, Delhi witnessed 11 heatwave days in April 2010.

53.title: Wanted to give him option against spin: McCullum on Venkatesh batting at no. 6
53.article_body: KKR head coach Brendon McCullum said they wanted to give all-rounder Venkatesh Iyer, who opened their batting in all earlier games, an option against the spin and that's why he was moved to number six against RR on Monday. "We thought that Narine and Finch at the top was a very good opportunity," added McCullum. KKR lost by seven runs.

54.title: Assam's Kamrup district gets its first transgender tea stall
54.article_body: Assam's first transgender tea stall was inaugurated in the Kamrup district on Monday. All Assam Transgender Association has set up the stall in collaboration with the district administration. "This tea stall aims to empower the trans community of Assam and help them learn entrepreneurial as well as business communication skills," said Swati Bidhan Baruah, founder of the transgender association.

55.title: Flight door opens mid-air in Brazil, passengers hold it shut for 20 mins
55.article_body: Pictures have surfaced online that showed the moment when the door of a plane flung open mid-air in Brazil. While the door’s handrail hit the engine’s propeller, passengers reportedly held the door closed for 20 minutes until the plane landed safely. The plane was an Embraer 110 Bandeirante, which can fly between 15 and 21 passengers.

56.title: Salman and me were cordial & nice but I was never really close to him: Bhumika
56.article_body: Actress Bhumika Chawla, who was seen alongside actor Salman Khan in 'Tere Naam', said that the two were cordial and nice but she was never really close to the actor. She also said that she did not have "that much" interaction with him on a personal front. "I don't think I could get influenced by him," she added.

57.title: Hyderabad police arrest 7 people, seize 190 kg of ganja
57.article_body: Hyderabad's Meerpet police have arrested seven people for allegedly smuggling drugs and seized 190 kg of ganja from their possession, the police said on Monday. The prime accused had also been previously jailed for transporting drugs, the police added. The arrest was made after police intercepted a car, carrying 64 packets of ganja, during checking, the police further said.

58.title: I'm very different from my dad, don't expect my son to be like me: Shahid
58.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor said that he is different from his father actor Pankaj Kapur. "I'm a different type of father...you understand what being a father means...It helps you have...better understanding of your parents...I don't expect my son to be like me...You have to choose what kind of a father you want to be," he added.

59.title: Robbers throw chilli powder, loot ₹1 crore from cash van at gunpoint in Gurugram
59.article_body: Around four-five armed robbers looted ₹1 crore from a van of a cash-collection company in Gurugram's Subhash Chowk area in broad daylight, said police. The accused allegedly threw chilli powder on the eyes of the guard and the van's driver and held them hostage at gunpoint. The guard told police that they had collected the money from 10 business establishments.

60.title: Israel strikes Gaza after rocket attack amid Jerusalem tensions
60.article_body: Israel on Tuesday carried out its first airstrikes on the Gaza Strip since January in response to a rocket fired from the Palestinian enclave amid Jerusalem tensions. The Israeli military said its aircraft attacked a "Hamas weapon manufacturing site". At least 152 Palestinians were injured in clashes with Israeli riot police inside Jerusalem's Al-Aqsa Mosque compound on Friday.

61.title: Bengaluru Police bust cryptocurrency scam; 4 arrested
61.article_body: Four people were reportedly arrested by Bengaluru Police in connection with a cryptocurrency ponzi scam on Monday. The accused were running the operation through a mobile app called ShareHash, said Kamal Pant, Commissioner of Police. "The app promised high returns on investments and collected crores of rupees from gullible people," he added.

62.title: Govt to continue 15-day fare limit on air travel: Civil Aviation Minister Scindia
62.article_body: The Ministry of Civil Aviation imposed a fare cap for 15 days on air travel due to the pandemic. Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia on Monday said, "If we talk about the fare caps, then it is my responsibility to the passengers as well as to the airlines...The decision to remove it will be taken at an appropriate time."

63.title: Video of KKR captain Shreyas Iyer arguing with head coach Brendon McCullum goes viral
63.article_body: A video of Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) captain Shreyas Iyer arguing with head coach Brendon McCullum after his dismissal against Rajasthan Royals (RR) has gone viral on social media. Iyer reportedly got angry over KKR's batting order during their run chase. RR won the match by seven runs. Iyer top-scored for KKR with 85(51).

64.title: Chahal recreates his World Cup meme pose to celebrate hat-trick, pic goes viral
64.article_body: Rajasthan Royals (RR) leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal recreated his 2019 World Cup 'relaxing' meme pose after taking a hat-trick and a five-wicket haul against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) in their IPL 2022 match. Chahal registered bowling figures of 4-0-40-5 as RR defeated KKR by seven runs. Chahal is currently the leading wicket-taker in IPL 2022 with 17 wickets in six matches.

65.title: 61-year-old man dies while fighting off phone snatchers in Mumbai
65.article_body: A 61-year-old man died after he fell and hit his head while fighting off robbers, who allegedly snatched his phone and assaulted him, in Mumbai's Malad West. The incident took place when the victim was walking back home after grocery shopping. The man reportedly died after making a call to his wife and informing her about the incident.

66.title: Pakistan cutting power supply to houses, industry amid fuel shortage
66.article_body: Pakistan is cutting electricity supply to households and industry as it's not able to afford buying coal or natural gas from overseas. A report said Pakistan's energy costs more than doubled in nine months ending February from last year. Former finance minister Miftah Ismail also shared a post detailing how much power had been cut due to fuel shortages.

67.title: Delhi HC seeks report from authorities on electric, CNG crematoriums
67.article_body: The Delhi High Court asked the local authorities to file a report in four weeks on number of electric and CNG crematoriums in the city and the steps taken to promote them instead of the wood pyres. The High Court bench gave the order while hearing petitions concerning burial and cremation of dead bodies amid the COVID-19 outbreak last year.

68.title: Apollo Global Management interested in a Twitter deal: Report
68.article_body: Private equity firm Apollo Global Management has expressed interest in participating in a deal for Twitter, Reuters reported citing sources. Apollo is seeking ways it can provide financing to any deal and is open to working with Musk or any other bidder. Earlier, Thoma Bravo had expressed interest in a buyout after Tesla CEO Elon Musk announced his bid.

69.title: 19-year-old killed in hit-and-run case in Pune, 1 arrested
69.article_body: A 19-year-old youth was killed in a hit-and-run case in Pune's Katraj and a truck driver has been arrested, police said. "There is parking at the back of the police station. But that space was booked for some party so he was taking the truck to the substitute location when he hit this person...ran over his head," police added.

70.title: The 2nd phase of war has started: Ukraine
70.article_body: As Russia launched a new offensive in the east of the country, Ukraine said that the second phase of war has started. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that a "very large part of the entire Russian army is now focused on this offensive." "No matter how many Russian troops they send there, we will fight," he added.

71.title: Duo talks about bid to loot 3rd temple near Pune bus stop; caught
71.article_body: Pune police arrested two people, aged 25 and 19, on Monday for alleged jewellery thefts at two temples in the city. The duo was caught while they were discussing their bid to loot a third temple near a bus stop in Warje Malwadi. Following the arrest, police recovered stolen jewellery and funds, worth a total of ₹18,234 from the duo.

72.title: 4-yr-old run over by school bus while being dropped off in Gurugram
72.article_body: A four-year-old boy died after he was allegedly run over by his school minibus while being dropped off in Gurugram, police said. "After he got off the bus, the driver drove the vehicle away...boy came under it," police added. "It appears he came under the tyres...He suffered several injuries on his stomach, arms and legs," the deceased's father said.

73.title: Female TikTok star jailed for 3 years for exploiting girls for money in Egypt
73.article_body: Female Egyptian TikTok star Haneen Hossam has been sentenced to three years in prison after being accused of exploiting girls for money through video-sharing platforms. Hossam was convicted of human trafficking over an invitation to her followers to get paid for making live videos. Human rights activists said she has been prosecuted as part of a crackdown on female influencers.

74.title: Police share picture of oldest Mumbai police station, say its 162 yrs old
74.article_body: Mumbai Police took to Twitter to share the picture of Pydhonie, the oldest police station in Mumbai. "With its stone facade and iron railing arch balconies on every floor, this 162-year-old police station has indeed bore witness to history," police wrote on Twitter. Pictures of other police stations along with their establishment details were also shared.

75.title: Cristiano Ronaldo announces death of his newborn son, asks for privacy
75.article_body: Cristiano Ronaldo announced that one of his newborn twins has passed away. Ronaldo, who was expecting twins with girlfriend Georgina Rodriguez, revealed she has given birth to a girl, while their son died. "It's the greatest pain that any parents can feel...We're all devastated at this loss and we kindly ask for privacy at this very difficult time," he wrote.

76.title: Brochara 2 premieres exclusively on Voot on 18 April 2022
76.article_body: Voot's new show Brochara 2 captures the bromance between four friends, Abhimanyu, Kanan, Shivashish and Pranay as they navigate life, ambitions, and relationships together with each other's unhindered support. The 5-episodic series boasts of Ankur Rathee, Amey Wagh, Varun Tewari, and Sayandeep Sengupta in the lead roles. Viewers can now watch the show for free on Voot.

77.title: Rajasthan Royals defeat Kolkata Knight Riders in 427-run thriller
77.article_body: Rajasthan Royals (RR) defeated Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) by seven runs in their IPL 2022 match on Monday to jump to the second position on the points table. RR put up a total of 217/5 with Jos Buttler scoring 103(61). KKR were bowled out for 210 in 19.4 overs. RR's Yuzvendra Chahal recorded figures of 4-0-40-5, including a hat-trick.

78.title: RR's Yuzvendra Chahal takes his first hat-trick in IPL
78.article_body: Rajasthan Royals (RR) leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal on Monday took his first hat-trick in IPL against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR). The 31-year-old dismissed KKR's Shreyas Iyer, Shivam Mavi and Pat Cummins in consecutive deliveries of his last over. Chahal recorded bowling figures of 4-0-40-5, his first five-wicket haul in IPL.

79.title: 12-yr-old student run over by bus in Punjab's Sangrur, 3 injured
79.article_body: A 12-year-old government school student was killed in Punjab's Sangrur while three others suffered serious injuries after a Pepsu Road Transport Corporation bus hit them on Monday. "It seems that the bus was at a high speed when it rammed into the schoolchildren," police said. The injured were taken to a civil hospital where they are undergoing treatment.

80.title: He's the punisher: Irfan after Buttler's 2nd ton in IPL 2022
80.article_body: After opener Jos Buttler hit his second century for RR against KKR at Brabourne Stadium on Monday in IPL 2022, ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan took to Twitter and wrote, "He [Buttler] is the punisher." Harbhajan Singh tweeted, "Different league Buttler boss." Praising Buttler, Michael Vaughan said, "Best T20 player in the world." Buttler scored 103 runs in 61 balls.

81.title: Those who do 'puja' can't create disturbance: Nitish on clashes
81.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar, while speaking about clashes that took place in some states during Hanuman Jayanti, said, "How could a person who wants to do puja...create...communal disturbance." He added that fringe elements are the ones who are involved in creating disharmony. He further said there wasn't any incident in Bihar as he "doesn't give any space for communal disturbance".

82.title: Sri Lanka may overcome economic crisis if govt, people cooperate: Ex-PM
82.article_body: Ex-Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe said on Monday that the country's ongoing economic crisis can be solved if both the government and citizens accept a uniform solution. He added that the anti-government protesters have created a situation of political instability in the country. Notably, Sri Lanka announced 17 new ministerial appointments today, weeks after 26 ministers resigned from Cabinet.

83.title: Big B confirms grandson Agastya Nanda's debut in 'The Archies'
83.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan on Monday confirmed his grandson Agastya Nanda's Bollywood debut with Zoya Akhtar's 'The Archies' by sharing a fan-made collage. He wrote on Twitter, "A new chapter begins in your life and there cannot be greater joy among us all. My blessings my love...Do well. AND keep the flag flying." Suhana Khan and Khushi Kapoor co-star in the film.

84.title: Denial of sex not 'exceptional hardship' to end marriage before 1-yr period: HC
84.article_body: Denial of sex is tantamount to "cruelty" but not "exceptional hardship", the Delhi High Court has said. It, hence, cannot be grounds for dissolution of marriage before the mandated cooling-off period of one year in a divorce case, it added. It said this while refusing to set aside a trial court order dismissing a mutual divorce petition of a couple.

85.title: Now my kids are old enough: Aishwaryaa on returning to work after 7yrs
85.article_body: Director Aishwaryaa Rajinikanth, who will be making her comeback after seven years, has said that she had taken a break to spend more time with her sons. She added that she got several offers to direct Hindi films but she wasn't in the mindset to work. "It feels great to be back. Now my children are old enough," Aishwaryaa said.

86.title: Post-Nadal stage will be difficult for Spanish tennis: Ferrer
86.article_body: Ex-world number three David Ferrer said it'll be a "difficult stage" for Spanish tennis after 35-year-old Rafael Nadal's retirement from the sport, adding the 21-time Grand Slam champion's shadow covers a lot. "There'll be no other player like him [Nadal]. But we're lucky. We've Carlos Alcaraz who is going to be a benchmark for Spanish tennis," he added.

87.title: Vande Bharat Express trains to run between Khajuraho and Delhi
87.article_body: The Vande Bharat Express train will operate between Khajuraho and Delhi soon, Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw has announced. He said, "Two rake points have been approved at Chhatarpur and Khajuraho. Rail tickets can now be obtained from 45,000 post offices". Vaishnaw, who was on a visit to Khajuraho, further said that after redevelopment, Khajuraho will become a world-class station.

88.title: Putin discusses Ukraine crisis with Palestinian President Abbas
88.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin held a phone call with his Palestinian counterpart Mahmoud Abbas and discussed the ongoing conflict in Ukraine, Kremlin said on Monday. The two leaders also discussed escalating tensions in West Bank and East Jerusalem, Kremlin added. At least 152 Palestinians were injured in clashes with Israeli riot police inside Jerusalem's Al-Aqsa mosque compound on Friday.

89.title: US to train Ukrainians to use Howitzers in coming days: Official
89.article_body: The US military plans to start training Ukrainian trainers on using the Howitzer artillery system in the coming days, a senior US official said on Monday. The training would take place outside Ukraine, the official added. The US and its allies have provided military aid to the Ukrainian military to help it fight Russian forces invading the country.

90.title: Wear masks in crowded places: Chandigarh govt amid COVID-19 rise
90.article_body: The Chandigarh Health Department on Monday issued an advisory asking people to wear face masks in crowded places in the wake of rising COVID-19 cases in some states and Union Territories. It said wearing of face masks is need to be especially ensured in closed environments like public transport. Masks should be used in classrooms and indoor gatherings, it added.

91.title: Johnny, Amber engaged in 'mutual abuse': Former marriage counsellor
91.article_body: In the defamation case filed by Johnny Depp against ex-wife Amber Heard, their former marriage counsellor has stated that they engaged in "mutual abuse". She added they were both domestically abused during childhood. "If Depp was [leaving] to de-escalate the fight, she'd hit him to keep him there...she'd rather be in a fight than have him leave," their counsellor said.

92.title: Mariupol is still contested between Russia & Ukraine: US official
92.article_body: The besieged Ukrainian city of Mariupol is still contested between Russian and Ukrainian forces, a senior US official said. The city remains under threat from Russian missile and artillery strikes, the official added. There are roughly 76 Russian battalion tactical groups in southern and eastern Ukraine, an increase of about 11 in recent days, the official further said.

93.title: 89 convicted of lynching Lankan man & burning his body in Pak, 6 sentenced to die
93.article_body: An anti-terrorism court in Pakistan on Monday convicted 89 people for lynching Sri Lankan man Priyantha Kumara and burning his body in December 2021. Six of the accused have been sentenced to death and seven were given life imprisonment in the case. A mob of over 800 people had attacked a garment factory and killed the 47-year-old over blasphemy allegations.

94.title: Duty to shut anything causing problems in a secular state: Assam CM
94.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Monday said it's a duty to shut anything irritating students or other communities in a secular state. "If there's a genuine demand around exams (to not play loudspeakers), don't play it," Sarma said. He also expressed concerns regarding several attempts made by fundamentalists to create a base in Assam with the help of sympathisers.

95.title: Biggest challenge in 'Jersey' was learning to play cricket at 39: Shahid
95.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor, on being asked about the biggest challenge playing a cricketer in upcoming film 'Jersey', said that it was learning to play cricket at the age of 39. He further said that he went through a lot of injuries. "I thought it'll be easy but I went through a very tough time learning the sport," the actor added.

96.title: KRK announces 'Deshdrohi 2', says it'll be bigger than 'Baahubali'
96.article_body: Actor-critic Kamaal R Khan on Monday announced his next film 'Deshdrohi 2' and shared its poster on Twitter which reads "bigger than 'Baahubali'". Kamaal tweeted that shooting for the film will begin soon. A social media user replied to the poster, "The movie nobody asked for and nobody needs," while another wrote, "India is not ready for another pandemic."

97.title: If I don't use a plane, I have less hours to work: World's richest man Musk
97.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk has said that he does not spend "billions of dollars a year" in personal consumption. Stating that his personal consumption is not high, Musk said in a TED interview, "The one exception is a plane, but if I don't use the plane, then I have less hours to work." He added, "I don't...really take vacations."

98.title: Ready to review executive powers, says Sri Lanka's Prez amid crisis
98.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa on Monday said that he's open to changes in the nation's constitution, potentially setting the stage for curbing the executive powers of his office. Rajapaksa's comment is an attempt to appease protesters calling for his ouster amid a severe economic crisis in the country, a report said. He appointed 17 new Cabinet ministers today.

99.title: No bhajan on loudspeakers near mosques around azaan call in Nashik
99.article_body: Nashik Police Commissioner Deepak Pandey on Monday issued a directive stating that no one will be allowed to play bhajan or other songs on loudspeaker 15 minutes before and after the call of azaan. This is applicable for areas within a 100-metre radius of any mosque. Pandey issued another directive instructing religious places to take prior permission for loudspeaker usage.

100.title: South Korea removes most COVID-19 restrictions as virus cases drop
100.article_body: South Korea has lifted most of its COVID-19 restrictions as new coronavirus cases dropped to 47,743 on Monday, the country's lowest daily tally in over two months. A midnight curfew on restaurants and other businesses has been removed, along with a limit of 10 people allowed to gather. People are, however, still required to wear masks outdoors.

101.title: Lalchand picks Jadeja and 4 other spinners for India's 2022 T20 WC squad
101.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Lalchand Rajput has picked all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja, Washington Sundar, Kuldeep Yadav, Yuzvendra Chahal and Ravi Bishnoi as spin bowlers who can be a part of Team India's squad for 2022 T20 World Cup in Australia. All five are currently playing for their respective teams in IPL 2022. The World Cup will begin on October 16.

102.title: Prashant Kishor meets Sonia, other top Cong leaders for 2nd time in 3 days
102.article_body: Political strategist Prashant Kishor met Congress chief Sonia Gandhi at her residence at 10 Janpath in Delhi on Monday. This is their second meeting at Sonia's residence in the last 3 days. The meeting comes amid reports of Kishor joining Congress ahead of the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. Congress leaders Priyanka Gandhi Vadra and P Chidambaram were also present.

103.title: 1984 a dark chapter in Indian history: Vivek Agnihotri on 'The Delhi Files'
103.article_body: Speaking about his upcoming film 'The Delhi Files', filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri stated that the year 1984 is a dark chapter in Indian history. He further said the way the Punjab terrorism situation was handled was inhuman, adding that it was purely for vote bank politics. "To date there has been no justice, what can be worse than that," Vivek said.

104.title: Delhi Capitals' Mitchell Marsh admitted to hospital after testing COVID-19 positive
104.article_body: Delhi Capitals all-rounder Mitchell Marsh has been admitted to hospital after testing COVID-19 positive, the IPL franchise said in a statement. "A few more members from the Delhi Capitals bio-bubble, including support staff members, have returned positive tests as well. Though they are all asymptomatic, their condition is being monitored closely by the franchise," the statement further read.

105.title: Russian missile strikes kill 7 in Ukraine's Lviv: Officials
105.article_body: At least seven people were killed and 11 others were injured in Russian missile strikes on Ukraine's Lviv, local authorities said on Monday. The youngest victim among the seven killed was aged 30, the Mayor of Lviv said. Notably, Lviv has become a major centre for NATO-supplied weapons and foreign fighters joining the Ukrainian side in the conflict.

106.title: Set an example so incidents like Jahangirpuri aren't repeated: Shah to Police
106.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Monday directed Delhi Police officials to take strict action against perpetrators of the Jahangirpuri violence. The action should be such that it sets a precedent so that such incidents are not repeated, Shah told the police officials. Over 20 people have been arrested in connection to the incident that took place on Saturday.

107.title: Whenever I, Ashwin are in nets we discuss last and next games: RR's Chahal
107.article_body: Speaking about the planning he does with his teammate Ravichandran Ashwin for the matches in ongoing IPL, RR spinner Yuzvendra Chahal said when they are practising in nets they both talk about previous and next matches. He added that they watch videos together and discuss which delivery to bowl to which batter. Chahal is leading wicket-taker in the tournament currently.

108.title: FIR filed against Jahangirpuri rally organisers for not taking permission
108.article_body: An FIR has been registered against the members of the Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) and Bajrang Dal for taking out a Hanuman Jayanti rally without permission in Delhi's Jahangirpuri, where violence was reported. "One accused person has joined the investigation," DCP (North West) Usha Rangnani said. The other two processions in Jahangirpuri area had due permission.

109.title: Yami Gautam was the first and only choice for 'Dasvi': Director
109.article_body: 'Dasvi' director Tushar Jalota in an interview has revealed that actress Yami Gautam was the first and only choice for policewoman Jyoti Daiswal. Tushar said that Jyoti is razor-focused, cutting sharp and has a steely authority. "When we were casting for this role in 'Dasvi', I couldn't imagine anyone else other than Yami Gautam playing Jyoti Daiswal," he added.

110.title: RR record the highest total of IPL 2022 so far
110.article_body: Rajasthan Royals (RR) put up a total of 217/5 against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) on Monday to record the highest total of IPL 2022 so far. This is Royals' second 200-plus total in IPL 2022. The previous highest total in IPL 2022 was 216/4, registered by Chennai Super Kings (CSK) against Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) on April 12.

111.title: Adani Green Energy overtakes SBI as India's 7th most valuable company
111.article_body: Adani Green Energy overtook the State Bank of India (SBI) on Monday to become the country's seventh most valuable company. The company's shares have surged over 120% year-to-date and its market valuation currently stands at ₹4.64 lakh crore. Adani Green is the only non-Sensex company featuring in the list of top 10 companies on BSE in terms of market capitalisation.

112.title: Cong's 3-day 'Chintan Shivir' likely to be held in Raj from May 14
112.article_body: Congress' three-day 'Chintan Shivir' is likely to be held in Rajasthan's Jaipur from May 14 onwards, sources said on Monday. Around 400 party leaders are expected to gather at meeting, which will focus on party's poll results in recently-held Assembly elections in five states. Notably, Rahul Gandhi was made party's Vice-President at Congress' last 'Chintan Shivir' in Jaipur in 2013.

113.title: Masks made mandatory in 4 Haryana districts as Gurugram sees 198 COVID-19 cases
113.article_body: The Haryana government on Monday made face masks mandatory in Gurugram, Faridabad, Sonipat and Jhajjar districts of the National Capital Region. This came amid a rise in COVID-19 cases in Gurugram which reported 198 fresh cases on Monday. Uttar Pradesh had earlier today made the wearing of face masks mandatory in Lucknow and six NCR districts.

114.title: I feel more content with the scripts I'm offered in South: Hansika
114.article_body: Actress Hansika Motwani said that she is more content with the scripts offered to her in South Indian films. "I enjoy doing all kinds of cinema, but I get more roles offered here," she added. However, she stated that being an entertainer, she'll entertain in any language if she gets a chance. "I have never put barricades around," she stated.

115.title: 'Coolie No. 1' actor Rajat Rawail hospitalised over varicose vein rupture
115.article_body: Varun Dhawan-starrer 2020 film 'Coolie No. 1' actor Rajat Rawail has been hospitalised following excessive loss of blood due to a rupture of a varicose vein in his right leg. Rajat was admitted to a hospital in Mumbai over the weekend, reported ETimes. The actor said that he has been advised total bed rest with no visitors.

116.title: Second Global COVID-19 Summit scheduled for May 12: US
116.article_body: The second Global COVID-19 Summit will be held on May 12 to discuss efforts to end the pandemic and prepare for future health threats, the US has announced. The virtual gathering will be co-chaired by the US, along with G7, G20, African Union and CARICOM, a Caribbean grouping. "Together, we can mitigate the impact of COVID-19," a joint statement said.

117.title: Delhi sees over 500 new COVID cases for 2nd straight day, positivity rate at 7.7%
117.article_body: Delhi on Monday reported 501 fresh cases of COVID-19 for the second straight day, after seeing 517 cases on Sunday. The daily positivity rate in the national capital was 7.72% on Monday as compared to 4.21% on Sunday, while no related deaths were recorded in the last 24 hours. The city now has 1,729 active COVID-19 cases.

118.title: Before 'Gangubai...' I'd be replaced at the last minute: Shantanu
118.article_body: Actor Shantanu Maheshwari, who made his Bollywood debut in Sanjay Leela Bhansali's 'Gangubai Kathiawadi', recalled his struggling days and said he would get rejected or replaced at the last minute in films. "I am glad those projects didn't happen because then 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' wouldn't have happened, I wouldn't have gotten a chance to work with Sanjay sir," he further stated.

119.title: Colourful seadragons wash up on Australian beaches after record rainfall
119.article_body: Dozens of colourful sea creatures have washed up on various Australian beaches following weeks of record rainfall. Pictures of the seadragons stranded on the beaches of Cronulla, Malabar and the Central Coast have been shared online. Experts say that the number of seadragons seen on beaches has been ten times the normal amount during the recent weeks.

120.title: Jos Buttler smashes his second hundred of IPL 2022
120.article_body: Rajasthan Royals (RR) opener Jos Buttler smashed his second hundred of IPL 2022 after reaching the three-figure mark off 59 deliveries against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) on Monday. Overall, it was Buttler's third IPL hundred for RR. He is the third cricketer after Virat Kohli and Chris Gayle to smash at least three hundreds for one franchise.

121.title: Calm character for someone who hasn't played a lot: Hesson on RCB's Shahbaz
121.article_body: RCB Director of Cricket Operations Mike Hesson said all-rounder Shahbaz Ahamad is a calming influence in the team. "We know he's got power, so at...back end, he chooses the right time to do it. He's a...calm character for someone who hasn't played too many games," he added. Shahbaz has scored 145 runs in four innings in IPL 2022 so far.

122.title: Barrage of Western sanctions against Russia failed: Prez Putin
122.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Monday claimed that the barrage of Western sanctions against Russia has failed. The West "expected to quickly upset the financial-economic situation, provoke panic in the markets, the collapse of the banking system and shortages in stores", he said. He also claimed that the sanctions have backfired on the West with a sharp rise in inflation.

123.title: Cyprus eases COVID-19 entry requirements for vaccinated arrivals
123.article_body: Cyprus on Monday announced that vaccinated arrivals won't have to undergo COVID-19 testing prior to boarding a flight or on arrival. Additionally, all Cyprus-bound passengers will no longer be required to fill out a travel form, also known as 'Cyprus Flight Pass'. Unvaccinated arrivals will, however, need to undergo either an RT-PCR or rapid antigen test prior to arrival.

124.title: Integrated command-control centre in all smart cities by Aug 15: Puri
124.article_body: Housing and Urban Affairs Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Monday said 80 out of 100 Smart Cities in India have Integrated Command and Control Centres and the remaining cities will get it by August 15. "Work has started in almost all government-funded projects [under] the Smart Cities Mission (SCM) and [the] projects...will be completed by next year," Puri added.

125.title: Twitter board members' salary will be $0 if I acquire the company: Musk
125.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk said on Monday that Twitter's board of directors will not receive any compensation if he succeeds in acquiring the company. "Board salary will be $0 if my bid succeeds, so that's ~$3 million/year saved right there," he tweeted. Twitter currently spends about $2.9 million in cash and stock awards to board members, as per filings.

126.title: Who is India's new Army chief Lieutenant General Manoj Pande?
126.article_body: Lieutenant General Manoj Pande will take charge as the 29th chief of the Army Staff in India. An alumnus of the National Defence Academy, Khadakwasla and the Indian Military Academy, Dehradun, Pande has a military career spanning nearly 40 years. He has commanded an engineer brigade along the LoC in J&K during Operation Parakram (during the 2001-2002 India-Pakistan standoff).

127.title: Anil forced Boney to give me hike in 'Woh 7 Din': Satish Kaushik
127.article_body: Actor Satish Kaushik has revealed that actor Anil Kapoor forced his brother producer Boney Kapoor to give him ₹501 from his earlier decided fee of ₹201 in 1983 film 'Woh 7 Din'. "The first day of shoot I had to wear a shirt. Anil brought one and said...Rishi Kapoor had worn it in 'Phool Khile Hain Gulshan Gulshan'," he added.

128.title: Lifetime chance for youngsters: Anand on 100-day countdown to Chess Olympiad
128.article_body: Marking the 100-day countdown for 44th Chess Olympiad, to be held in Chennai, on Monday, five-time world chess champion Viswanathan Anand said the tournament is a life-time opportunity for youngsters to catch a glimpse of their idols. "Watch them play and possibly interact with them," he added. The Olympiad will be held from July 28 to August 10.

129.title: Sayani Gupta, Tamannaah wear same saree at Iftaar party, share pics
129.article_body: Actresses Sayani Gupta and Tamannaah Bhatia on Sunday turned up in the same saree designed by Monica Shah and Karishma Swali's brand Jade at Baba Siddiqui's Iftaar party. Sayani took to Instagram Stories to share pictures with Tamannaah, writing, "Tamannaah and I were twinning. Thanks @jady_bymk for giving us the same outfits. Had to take photos."

130.title: It started in my 30s: Jennifer Aniston on battling insomnia
130.article_body: Actress Jennifer Aniston has revealed that she battles with insomnia and said that it started in her 30s. "I dread spending another night counting cracks in the walls...And the more I worry about it [sleeping]...harder it is to fall asleep," she told the People magazine. Jennifer further said she used to sleepwalk, however, added she doesn't do it anymore.

131.title: Rise in private debt due to COVID-19 may affect growth over 3 yrs: IMF
131.article_body: A chapter of the International Monetary Fund's (IMF) World Economic Outlook said debt accumulated by the private sector during the COVID-19 pandemic could lower growth for emerging markets by 1.3% over three years. For developed nations, growth is expected to be reduced by 0.9%. IMF had earlier forecasted advanced and emerging markets to grow at 3.9% and 4.8% in 2022.

132.title: Ultimately, nobody will be able to pay more for talent than TCS: CEO
132.article_body: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) CEO Rajesh Gopinathan called the current scramble for employees "transitory" and argued that, ultimately, nobody will be able to pay more for talent than TCS, Bloomberg reported. He said that TCS enjoys the highest structural margins. "We enjoy the benefit of occupying the high point on the profitability side...everybody else is benchmarked below us," he added.

133.title: World Bank cuts global growth forecast to 3.2% due to Ukraine war
133.article_body: World Bank President David Malpass on Monday said the bank has cut its global growth forecast for 2022 from 4.1% to 3.2% owing to the Russia-Ukraine war. Forecasts are being cut for advanced and many developing economies because of spikes in food, energy prices, Malpass said. World Bank is also proposing a new, 15-month crisis financing target of $170 billion.

134.title: Railway police officer killed, another injured in terror attack in J&K
134.article_body: A Railway Protection Force Head Constable was killed and an Assistant Sub-Inspector injured after terrorists opened fire at them in Jammu and Kashmir's Pulwama district on Monday, officials said. The incident took place near a tea stall in Kakapora area. After the attack, Head Constable Surinder Singh and ASI Devraj were taken to a hospital where Singh was declared dead.

135.title: 27-year-old Iñaki Williams goes 6 years without missing a La Liga match
135.article_body: Athletic Club forward Iñaki Williams has now gone six years without missing a La Liga match. The 27-year-old Spanish footballer achieved the feat after being named in starting XI for Sunday's La Liga match against Celta Vigo. He has now played 227 La Liga matches in a row. He holds the record for most consecutive appearances in La Liga.

136.title: I haven't replied to Congress' show-cause notice: Sunil Jakhar
136.article_body: Ex-Punjab Congress chief Sunil Jakhar on Monday said he hasn't replied to the show-cause notice issued to him by the Congress disciplinary committee. The notice was issued on April 11 for going against "party line" and using "objectionable words" for the Dalit community. Jakhar has denied making any statement against the community saying his remarks were put "out of context".

137.title: Man with knife arrested after confronting police near UK PM's home
137.article_body: The UK Police on Monday said that they've arrested a 29-year-old man armed with a knife who confronted two Ministry of Defence police officers near British PM's official residence in London. The incident isn't being treated as terror-related, it added. "He was arrested on suspicion of attempted murder and...remains in custody at a central London police station," it further said.

138.title: Cycle theft accused dies in custody in Odisha, family alleges torture
138.article_body: A cycle theft accused from Odisha's Bhubaneswar, who died in police custody after being arrested on Sunday, was allegedly tortured, his family has claimed. The deceased's wife said she found her husband dead after being asked to come to the hospital late at night. "If...police nabbed my husband at 7.30 pm, why did they inform...at 1.30 am," his wife said.

139.title: Minor girl, man found hanging from tree in Punjab's Ferozepur
139.article_body: The bodies of a minor girl and a man were found hanging from a tree in a village in Punjab's Ferozepur on Monday. The bodies were first spotted at around 7.30 am by local residents who then informed the police. A motorcycle that was parked nearby has been impounded and the bodies have been sent for post-mortem.

140.title: Gold prices jump to 1-month high amid Russia-Ukraine war, inflation concerns
140.article_body: Gold prices jumped to more than one-month high on Monday amid concerns over economic fallout from Russia-Ukraine war and surging inflation. Spot gold rose 0.9% to $1,991.51 per ounce. Among other metals, spot silver rose 1% to $25.93 per ounce, whereas Platinum climbed 1.8%. Bullion is considered a safe store of value during times of political and economic crisis.

141.title: US official to visit Solomon Islands amid concerns over China pact
141.article_body: The White House on Monday said that US Indo-Pacific Coordinator Kurt Campbell will visit the Solomon Islands this week, amid concerns about the potential security pact between the island country and China. Earlier, Australia's Minister for the Pacific had visited the country to discuss the proposed security pact. The agreement would allow China to deploy its military in the region.

142.title: 2 captured Britons come on Russian state TV, ask to be swapped with Putin ally
142.article_body: Two British soldiers captured in Ukraine by Russian forces appeared on Russian state TV on Monday and asked to be exchanged for an ally of Vladimir Putin known as the 'Prince of darkness'. Shaun Pinner and Aiden Aslin appealed to UK PM Boris Johnson to negotiate their release in exchange for Viktor Medvedchuk, a Ukrainian politician who's close to Putin.

143.title: Maha govt must ban leaders' rallies who create communal tensions: Patole
143.article_body: Congress' Nana Patole said on Monday that the Maharashtra government must ban public rallies of political leaders who try to create communal tensions. Patole's remark comes a day after Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray announced that he'll conduct a rally in Aurangabad on May 1. Thackeray had earlier demanded the removal of loudspeakers from mosques by May 3.

144.title: Islamic body moves SC against bulldozing houses of riot accused
144.article_body: Islamic body Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind has moved Supreme Court seeking appropriate direction to states against demolishing houses of accused in cases of violence. This comes after Madhya Pradesh government used bulldozers to raze down houses of persons accused of rioting during a Ram Navami procession in Khargone. The petitioner said resorting to such measures is clearly against constitutional ethos.

145.title: Nadal trains for first time in a month since Indian Wells final, shares pic
145.article_body: Twenty-one time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal took to Twitter to share a photo of himself training for the first time since losing in Indian Wells Masters last month. "Today after four weeks without stepping on a tennis court, first light training. What an illusion to step on the earth again!" he wrote. Nadal had injured his rib in semi-final.

146.title: I always found it tough to bowl to Sehwag in IPL: KKR spinner Narine
146.article_body: Ahead of his 150th IPL match, KKR spinner Sunil Narine was asked who he thinks played him the best in IPL, to which he replied Virender Sehwag. "I always found it tough because he was a guy who always kept the game going no matter what situation the team was in, he kept batting the way he did," he added.

147.title: Provide COVID-19 data daily: Centre as Kerala reports data after 5-day gap
147.article_body: Union Health Ministry has written a letter to Kerala Principal Secretary Rajan Khobragade, asking him to ensure updating COVID-19 data daily as the state reported its data after five days since April 13. ''Daily and diligent reporting of data is critical to arrive at a meaningful understanding of the pandemic in districts, state and national level," the ministry added.

148.title: Kangana is Brahmastra in reality show 'Lock Upp': Tusshar Kapoor
148.article_body: Actor Tusshar Kapoor has stated that ALT Balaji has launched a Brahmastra in the form of actress Kangana Ranaut as a host on reality show 'Lock Upp'. "She's the perfect person to host the show. Her frank attitude...courageous nature and the confidence with which she tells people their truth or judges them...is very fair and very real," the actor added.

149.title: KKR to bowl first against RR, RR make three changes to their playing XI
149.article_body: Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) captain Shreyas Iyer won the toss and elected to bowl first against Rajasthan Royals (RR) in their IPL 2022 clash on Monday. KKR have made one change to their playing XI, with Shivam Mavi replacing Aman Khan. RR have included Karun Nair, Obed McCoy and Trent Boult in their playing XI.

150.title: Previous govts left Punjab with a debt of ₹3 lakh crore: CM Mann
150.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Monday blamed state's previous governments for its debt. "Previous governments...left a debt of ₹3 lakh crore on Punjab. But where has this loan been used? We'll investigate and recover [the amount],” AAP's Punjab unit tweeted quoting Mann. Notably, Mann sought financial package of ₹1 lakh crore for state from PM Narendra Modi after assuming charge.

151.title: 8-yr-old boy found dead in Pune's Chikhali, murder probe launched
151.article_body: An 8-year-old boy was found dead with a "fatal injury inflicted with a blunt hard object" at a tin shed in Pune's Chikhali on Sunday, police said. His family had lodged a missing complaint when he didn't return home for a long time following which a search was launched. We've registered a murder case and launched a probe, police added.

152.title: Pressure is at its highest: Zaheer on MI's 6-match losing streak
152.article_body: MI Director of Cricket Operations Zaheer Khan said that the pressure level is "at its highest" for the team as they've lost six consecutive matches in ongoing IPL. "This is a team sport so we have to stick together, have to find ways of coming together and then become a force," he stated. It's MI's worst start in IPL history.

153.title: Don't remember last time I saw damsel in distress on screen: Avantika
153.article_body: Actress Avantika Dassani has stated that she doesn't remember the last time she saw a damsel in distress on the screen. "Everyone keeps asking me this question and I ask them the last time they saw it too," she added. The actress further said that she doesn't want to limit herself to anything, adding that all experiences are welcome.

154.title: Hardik has absolutely thrived in captaincy role for GT in IPL: Kirsten
154.article_body: Praising Hardik Pandya for leading GT in IPL 2022, batting coach Gary Kirsten said Hardik is a class and has absolutely thrived in the new role of a captain. "He's a fantastic batter...can play in a lot of different ways...he's played with great maturity," Kirsten added. GT are currently on top of standings, winning five of six matches so far.

155.title: Turkey launches military operation against Kurdish militants in Iraq
155.article_body: Turkey on Monday announced the launch of a new ground and air cross-border military operation against Kurdish militants in northern Iraq. The jets successfully struck shelters, bunkers, caves, tunnels, ammunition depots and headquarters belonging to the militants, the Turkish Defence Minister said. At least 19 Kurdish militants were killed and about four Turkish soldiers were injured, he added.

156.title: Speculative in nature: Mindtree on report of $22 bn merger with L&T Infotech
156.article_body: Mindtree on Monday clarified that news reports of its merger with Larsen & Toubro Infotech are "speculative in nature". Mindtree said, "We would like to state that there is no information available with the company as of today." Bloomberg earlier reported that Larsen & Toubro is considering a merger between the two software firms to create a $22 billion firm.

157.title: What is 'pyramid fraud' that Amway India is accused of running?
157.article_body: The ED accused Amway India of running a 'pyramid fraud' and provisionally attached its assets worth ₹757.77 crore. It alleged Amway of running a pyramid fraud in the guise of direct selling multi-level marketing network and exorbitant pricing of products. "Gullible public is induced to join as members and purchase products at exorbitant prices, losing their hard-earned money," ED said.

158.title: Fati was born to score goals, he reminds me of Samuel Eto'o: Alves
158.article_body: Barcelona player Dani Alves has said that forward Ansu Fati reminds him of former Barcelona forward Samuel Eto'o. "Fati was born to score goals...He is a machine for destroying defences. I think he can also define an era, a special history within Barcelona," Dani added. Fati donned the number 10 jersey after Lionel Messi's departure from the club.

159.title: Lt Gen Manoj Pande appointed Indian Army chief, 1st engineer to hold the post
159.article_body: Lieutenant General Manoj Pande was on Monday appointed as the new chief of the Indian Army. He's the first engineer to hold the post. Pande, who was appointed Vice Chief of the Army Staff in February 2022, will succeed General MM Naravane as Army chief. A decision on the appointment of the Chief of Defence Staff is reportedly still pending.

160.title: Investors lose ₹2.5 lakh crore wealth in a day as Sensex crashes 1,170 points
160.article_body: Nearly ₹2.5 lakh crore was wiped off investors' wealth on Monday as Sensex plunged 1,172 points to settle at 57,166 amid weak global cues. The market capitalisation of BSE-listed companies dropped to ₹269.48 lakh crore from ₹ 272.12 lakh crore in the previous session. Infosys, HDFC, HDFC Bank, Tech Mahindra, Wipro and TCS were among the top losers on Monday.

161.title: Central Railway organises unique light & sound show at Mumbai's CSMT
161.article_body: Central Railway organised a unique light and sound show at the Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus (CSMT) heritage building on Sunday to commemorate entering 170th year of Indian Railways. The show was titled 'Navarasangam - ek gatha CSMT ki'. It also commemorated the World Heritage Day, Railway Week and Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav, a celebration of 75 years of India's independence.

162.title: Real Madrid's Benzema is exceptional: Man City manager Pep Guardiola
162.article_body: Ahead of the Champions League semifinal fixture against Real Madrid, Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola has said that Real Madrid forward Karim Benzema is exceptional. "Benzema is not only a scorer but is a fantastic all-round player. His career is phenomenal," Guardiola added. In the ongoing Champions League season, Benzema has scored 12 goals in nine games played so far.

163.title: Kejriwal to visit Bengaluru on April 21, attend farmers' convention
163.article_body:
Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal will visit Bengaluru on April 21 and attend a convention of farmers on the invitation of Karnataka Rajya Raitha Sangha chief and farmer leader Kodihalli Chandrashekhar. 
AAP's Karnataka Convener Prithvi Reddy said the party is the platform for people who fight for farmers' cause. He said AAP wants to get such people elected to Vidhana Soudha.

164.title: Govt registered highest-ever 1.67 lakh companies in FY22, up 8% YoY
164.article_body: Corporate Affairs Ministry registered over 1.67 lakh companies incorporations in FY22, an 8% YoY increase from 1.55 lakh companies incorporations registered in FY21. This is the highest number of company incorporations in a financial year till date. The Ministry said it has taken many initiatives for reducing the number of procedures, time and cost for starting a business in India.

165.title: Goa CM should withdraw comments on 'religious conversion': Cong leader
165.article_body: Congress' Michael Lobo reacted to Goa CM Pramod Sawant's comments on 'religious conversion', stating that Sawant should withdraw the "unwarranted" remarks. "[Sawant's] trying to polarise one section of the society...[he] needs to take everyone along," Lobo added. Sawant had said that Goa government will never allow religious conversions in the state, adding that people should be vigilant about it.

166.title: If philanthropy is love of humanity, my companies are philanthropy: Musk
166.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk said SpaceX, Tesla, Neuralink and The Boring Company, the companies that he has founded, are philanthropy. "If you say philanthropy is love of humanity, they are philanthropy," Musk added. Asked about his views on billionaire philanthropy, he said, "If you care about reality of goodness instead of the perception of it, philanthropy is extremely difficult."

167.title: Noida parents protest school fee hike by polishing shoes
167.article_body: A group of parents in Greater Noida on Sunday polished shoes on the roadside as a symbolic gesture to protest against the hike in fees by private schools. The protest comes despite a UP government order that allowed the schools to hike their fees. The protestors have appealed to the CM to withdraw the order to make education more accessible.

168.title: Pics show final moments of Russian warship after being hit by Ukrainian missiles
168.article_body: Pictures and footage purportedly showing the final moments of the Russian warship Moskva that sank after being hit by two Ukrainian missiles, have been widely shared online. The ship went down in the Black Sea last week after Ukraine said it launched two Neptune missiles. Russia had, however, cited stormy seas as the reason, which the pictures seem to contradict.

169.title: Which cricketers from inaugural IPL match 14 years ago are still playing in IPL?
169.article_body: The first-ever IPL match took place on April 18, 2008 between KKR and RCB. KKR were led by Sourav Ganguly, while RCB were captained by Rahul Dravid. Virat Kohli and Wriddhiman Saha, who are playing in IPL 2022, also featured in the first-ever IPL match. Saha, who made his GT debut on Sunday, represented KKR in the inaugural match.

170.title: NASA shares picture of sunrise on Mars
170.article_body: NASA has shared a picture of the sunrise on Mars captured by its InSight lander. "On April 10, 2022, the 1198th sol (or Martian day) of its mission, our InSight lander took this photo of Martian dawn on the plains of Elysium Planitia," NASA said. InSight is NASA's first mission to study the interior of Mars in depth.

171.title: I'm happy South films are breaking into new territories: Anil Kapoor
171.article_body: Anil Kapoor said that the South has always been making "exceptional" films and added he is "happy" that South films are breaking into new territories. "I started my career with films down south and it gives me immense pleasure to see them doing so good," he stated. This comes after 'RRR', and 'Pushpa: The Rise' were commercial successes across India.

172.title: Ukraine has completed questionnaire for EU membership: Official
172.article_body: Ukraine has completed a questionnaire that will form the starting point for the European Union (EU) to consider the country's membership in the bloc, Ihor Zhovkva, Deputy Head of President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's Office, said. Ukraine expects to acquire candidate country status for accession to the EU in June, Zhovkva added. Ukraine signed an application to join the EU in February.

173.title: Shocking and saddening: PM Modi on the demise of 18-year-old TT player Vishwa
173.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday tweeted, "The demise of TT champion Vishwa Deenadayalan is shocking and saddening." The 18-year-old table tennis player from Tamil Nadu died in a road accident on Sunday while travelling from Guwahati to Shillong for the 83rd Senior National and Inter-State Table Tennis Championship. PM Modi said Vishwa had distinguished himself in several competitions.

174.title: Who is Jammu fruit seller's son Umran Malik, the fastest Indian bowler in IPL 2022?
174.article_body: SRH pacer Umran Malik, the fastest Indian bowler in IPL 2022, was born on November 22, 1999 in Jammu and Kashmir. His father is a fruit seller.
