Umran was SRH's net bowler in IPL 2021 and he replaced T Natarajan in main squad after the latter was ruled out due to COVID-19. He was retained by SRH for ₹4 crore.

175.title: Never ever get a tattoo: Samantha to fan despite having 3 tattoos
175.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu held an 'ask me anything' session on Instagram Stories during which a fan asked for tattoo suggestions. The actress responded, "You know the one thing I'd tell my younger self is never ever get a tattoo. Never. Never ever. Ever, get a tattoo."  Samantha reportedly has three tattoos connected to her ex-husband Naga Chaitanya.

176.title: Training aircraft of pvt flying school topples on runway, 1 injured
176.article_body: A training aircraft of a private flying school toppled during landing at the Jakkur Aerodrome in Bengaluru on Sunday evening. An international skydiving champion, who was on the aircraft, received minor injuries as she was rescued by the pilot. The pilot reportedly spotted dogs and birds on the runway after landing and acted immediately.

177.title: 4 civilians shot dead in Ukraine's Luhansk region: Governor
177.article_body: Four civilians were reportedly shot dead during a Russian attack in Ukraine's eastern Luhansk region. The victims were trying to flee the Kreminna city by car when the incident occurred, said regional Governor Serhiy Gaidai in a Telegram post, according to a report. Meanwhile, multiple blasts were reported in Ukraine's Kyiv, Lviv and Dnipro regions.

178.title: Body of unidentified man found at Vasai beach in Palghar
178.article_body: The body of an unidentified man was found in a highly decomposed state at Vasai's Bhuigaon beach in Maharashtra's Palghar district. The body was spotted by fishermen and local people on Sunday evening, police said, adding that prima facie, the body was swept ashore by sea waves. A case of accidental death has been registered and an investigation is underway.

179.title: Noida is UP's crown just as Kashmir is India's crown: UP minister
179.article_body: UP Cabinet Minister Nand Gopal Gupta on Sunday said, "The way Kashmir...is a crown for India similarly, Noida is Uttar Pradesh's crown." Gupta made the comment during a visit to Noida on the occasion of the city's 47th foundation day. He inaugurated and laid foundation stones to projects worth ₹107 crore during the visit.

180.title: 20 injured after bus overturns in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar
180.article_body: A bus returning from a marriage party overturned on the Khuria Rahatgarh road in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar district on Monday. According to the police, at least 20 passengers got injured after the bus skidded off the road. The bus, which was returning to Kesli, overturned after its driver, who later fled the spot, dozed off while driving, police said.

181.title: Stones pelted at ladies coach in Bandra, railway police file case
181.article_body: The railway police have suo motu registered a case following a tip-off about an alleged stone-pelting incident. According to police, a female commuter informed on a helpline that an unknown person pelted stones on a ladies' coach of a local train when it halted at Bandra station's platform seven. The train had, however, left when police reached the platform.

182.title: Ukrainian pilots launch 'buy me a jet' website to crowdfund war planes
182.article_body: Ukrainian pilots have launched a website 'buymeafighterjet.com' seeking crowdfunding to purchase new fighter jets amid the country's war with Russia. A video uploaded on the website showed destroyed Ukrainian military equipment and infrastructure while a pilot looks into the camera and said, "Buy me a fighter jet". As per the website, the average cost of a jet is $25 million.

183.title: SRK & Shehnaaz hug each other at Baba Siddique's Iftar party, video surfaces
183.article_body: Indian politician Baba Siddique hosted an annual Iftaar party at Hotel Taj Lands End in Mumbai's Bandra which was attended by several celebrities. Recently a video has surfaced online where Shehnaaz was all smiles as she hugged actor Shah Rukh Khan. For the party, Shehnaaz opted to wear a light grey Patiala suit along with matching jhumkas.

184.title: Tusshar congratulates Ranbir-Alia, says 'It was private wedding which I respect'
184.article_body: Tusshar Kapoor on Monday congratulated the newlywed Bollywood couple Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt. "Very nice pictures, very natural. It was a private wedding which [I] respect," he said while talking to the media. "My best wishes from the family because Chintu Ji (Rishi Kapoor) was my father's (Jeetendra) close friend. So hearty wishes to them from...entire family," Tusshar added.

185.title: My 94*(51) vs CSK reminds me of my 2013 century for KXIP: Miller
185.article_body: After playing a match-winning knock of 94 runs against CSK, the Gujarat Titans batter David Miller said that this knock reminded him of his century which he scored for the Kings XI Punjab in 2013. "It does take me back to memory lane (referring to the 2013 knock)...with the rate quite high, I wanted to express myself (yesterday)," Miller said.

186.title: It was a minor incident: Police on fresh stone-pelting in Jahangirpuri
186.article_body: The fresh stone-pelting in Delhi's Jahangirpuri, where a communal violence broke out on Saturday, was a minor and one-off incident, police said on Monday. "Legal action is being taken. One person has been detained," it added. Police had earlier said that family members of an accused pelted two stones at a team when they went to question them.

187.title: Cyrus Sahukar's wife Vaishali Malahara shares wedding pics
187.article_body: Actor Cyrus Sahukar's wife Vaishali Malahara on Monday shared pictures from their wedding day on Instagram. She wrote, "With These 7 steps May you become my friend and May I deserve your friendship. May my friendship make me one with you and May your friendship make you one with me." The couple got married on April 15 in Alibaug.

188.title: People have wrong impression of Harsh Varrdhan that he's introvert: Anil on son
188.article_body: Speaking about his son, actor-producer Harsh Varrdhan, Anil Kapoor said people have this wrong impression of him that he's introverted and serious. "I was happy that media, critics and everybody praised his work and loved what he did [in AKvsAK]," he added. Speaking about his second collaboration with Harsh Varrdhan, Anil hilariously revealed Harsh Varrdhan rejected some of his suggestions.

189.title: Invited Macron to see evidence of ‘genocide’ in Ukraine: Zelenskyy
189.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that he has invited his French counterpart Emmanuel Macron to visit Ukraine and see the evidence of 'genocide'. "I want him (Macron) to understand that this is not war, but...[a] genocide," Zelenskyy added. His comments come days after Macron refused to call the ongoing Russian military offensive in Ukraine a 'genocide' in an interview.

190.title: Watching Umran bowl at 150 clicks an hour is super exciting: Steyn
190.article_body: SunRisers Hyderabad pace bowling coach Dale Steyn has said that watching the 22-year-old pacer Umran Malik "bowl at 150 clicks an hour consistently is super exciting". "Very often we try and create guys to make them more aware like changing your pace...But I think Umran is out and out raw. It's great to just let him loose," Steyn said.

191.title: 2 youths die after drowning in waterfall on Nagaon-Karbi Anglong border
191.article_body: Two youths lost their lives after  they drowned in a waterfall on Assam's Nagaon-Karbi Anglong district border. Police said that the deceased have been identified as Sajadul Islam and Raj Bora. Reports said that four people including the deceased had visited the waterfall and had gone missing. Police added that they reached the spot after getting information from the locals.

192.title: 3 masked men try to rob Ludhiana finance company’s office, manage to escape
192.article_body: Three masked men attempted to rob the office of a finance company in Ludhiana’s Raikot on Saturday. The manager of the firm said the robbers asked him to hand over almirah's keys to them. On resisting, the accused opened fire in the air. However, after the manager raised the alarm, the accused persons managed to escape.

193.title: Best hospitality in the world: Pietersen in Hindi before joining IPL commentary team
193.article_body: Former England captain Kevin Pietersen on Monday praised India in a tweet in Hindi ahead of joining the IPL commentary team and said, "Very excited to be back in India." He added, "Experiencing the best hospitality in the world is something I will never take lightly! See you in a few hours, India!"

194.title: They once had to eat samosas for breakfast: Rai on issues faced by India Women in 2017 WC
194.article_body: Talking about issues faced by India Women during 2017 World Cup, Vinod Rai revealed ahead of India's semi-final match against Australia, the players couldn't get the food they were supposed to. "They had to eat samosas for breakfast that morning!" Rai added that Harmanpreet Kaur, who scored 171* in that match, told him that she was cramping during her knock.

195.title: Bitcoin falls to lowest in a month, global crypto market's value falls to $1.9 trillion
195.article_body: The world's largest cryptocurrency Bitcoin fell as much as 4.2% to $38,580 and the second-largest cryptocurrency, Ether, dropped 4.7% to as low as $2,902 on Monday. The global crypto market’s value dropped about 4% in the past 24 hours to $1.9 trillion, according to the pricing from CoinGecko. Bitcoin has been struggling along with risk assets in recent months.

196.title: Keerthy congratulates Madhavan's son on bagging gold at Danish Open
196.article_body: Actress Keerthy Suresh took to Twitter to congratulate Madhavan's 16-year-old son Vedaant on winning a gold medal in swimming at the Danish Open 2022. "Kudos to the champion Vedaant Madhavan. Your achievement is an inspiration to all! Congratulations to the proud father," she wrote. Vedaant won the medal in the 800m swimming event.

197.title: Sri Lanka Cricket asked to confirm on hosting Asia Cup by July 27: Report
197.article_body: Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) board has been reportedly asked by the Asian Cricket Council (ACC) to decide on hosting the Asia Cup tournament by July 27. The tournament is scheduled to be held in Sri Lanka but the ongoing economic and political crisis in the country might take away the hosting rights from the SLC, a source said.

198.title: Party will decide on plan to expand, rejig Cabinet: K'taka CM
198.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Monday said BJP President JP Nadda will hold a meeting regarding the state and thereafter decide on Karnataka Cabinet's expansion or reshuffle. This comes as BJP gears up for Karnataka Assembly polls which are scheduled to be held next year. There are currently 29 ministers in the state Cabinet against the sanctioned strength of 34.

199.title: Was never influenced by Salman Khan: 'Tere Naam' co-star Bhumika
199.article_body: Actress Bhumika Chawla, speaking about her 'Tere Naam' co-star Salman Khan, has said that she was never influenced by him "in any such manner". Bhumika added, "Salman has changed a lot, I see so much difference." "From what I hear...[Salman has] seen a kind of good growth in him as a person and even as an artist," she further stated.

200.title: I smeared henna all over my face at Alia-Ranbir's mehendi: Karan
200.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar has revealed that he mistakenly smeared henna all over his face at Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor's mehendi ceremony. He said that he had decided to get mehendi on his hands but wasn't used to it and tried wiping sweat from his face but smeared it with henna. "Alia's makeup artist...applied lotion on my face." Karan added.

201.title: Won’t accept N Korea’s escalating tests as normal: US envoy
201.article_body: A US official has called for a joint deterrent along with South Korea against North Korea's escalating weapons tests. "It is extremely important for the United Nations Security Council to send a clear signal to the DPRK (Democratic People's Republic of Korea) that we will not accept its escalatory tests as normal," said Sung Kim, US envoy on North Korea.

202.title: Mariupol doesn't exist anymore: Ukraine's Foreign Minister after Russian siege
202.article_body: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba has said the port city of Mariupol "doesn't exist anymore". "The situation in Mariupol is both dire militarily and heartbreaking. The city doesn't exist anymore," Kuleba told CBS News. "It seems from the way the Russian army behaves in Mariupol, they decided to raze the city to the ground at any cost,"  he added.

203.title: Curfew in 2 Amravati cities after stone-pelting incidents; 23 arrested
203.article_body: Curfew was imposed in Achalpur and Paratwada in Maharashtra's Amravati Rural after two groups pelted stones at each other allegedly over removal of religious flags on Sunday. Police have arrested 23 people for rioting. Three companies of the State Reserve Police Force (SRPF), 300 police personnel from Amravati Police and other security personnel have been deployed to keep vigil.

204.title: Can't ignore work: Bharti to trolls who criticised her for working post-pregnancy
204.article_body: Comedian-host Bharti Singh reacted to trolls who criticised her for working post-pregnancy. She reportedly said that she's not an angel who can rest forever. She added there are a lot of working women who leave their one-week-old kids at home to resume work. Bharti further said there are work commitments that one cannot ignore, hence work has to be resumed.

205.title: Have written a very strong story: Director Koratala Siva on 'NTR30'
205.article_body: Filmmaker Koratala Siva, speaking about his upcoming film with Jr NTR, has said, "Pre-production work currently going on...we're aiming to commence the shoot in June." "Have written a very strong story...which can reach a large set of audience" he added. The film is tentatively named 'NTR30'. Reportedly, Alia Bhatt was offered the female lead, however, she declined.

206.title: Captaincy comes naturally to Iyer, his mindset is clear: Ravi Shastri
206.article_body: Former India cricketer Ravi Shastri has said that "captaincy comes naturally" to KKR skipper Shreyas Iyer. "You don't feel like he's (Iyer) leading KKR for the first time. Looks like he's been captaining them for the last three-to-four seasons," Shastri said. "Iyer's mindset is clear about what brand of cricket he needs to play as a batter," he added.

207.title: Maoists kill 30-yr-old man who had come to meet relatives in Chhattisgarh
207.article_body: A 30-year-old man was allegedly killed by Maoists at Kolaiguda in Chhattisgarh's Sukma district in the early hours of Monday. The deceased has been identified as Dudhi Ganga. Ganga was a resident of Telangana and had run away from his village in Chhattisgarh years ago. He had come back to meet relatives at some function, police said.

208.title: Action to be taken without bias: Delhi Police Commissioner on Jahangirpuri violence
208.article_body: Delhi Police Commissioner Rakesh Asthana on Monday said that action will be taken without bias against all those found to be involved in the communal clashes in Jahangirpuri. "We will take action against whomever evidence of involvement is found during the investigation, irrespective of religion, creed, caste and community," Asthana said.

209.title: FIR not an encyclopedia of events: SC on HC granting bail to Ashish Mishra
209.article_body: The Supreme Court has cancelled the bail granted to Union Minister Ajay Mishra Teni's son Ashish Mishra in the Lakhimpur case. Referring to Allahabad High Court's earlier order which granted bail to Ashish, it said, "FIR cannot be treated as an encyclopedia of events. Judicial precedents were ignored." It also said victims were denied the chance of an effective hearing.

210.title: Malaika returns to work after car accident, says 'feels good to be back'
210.article_body: Malaika Arora, who met with an accident on Mumbai-Pune highway earlier this month, shared on Monday that she has returned to work. Malaika, taking to Instagram Stories, shared a picture from a set, writing, "Feels good to be back on set." Malaika got into a car accident on April 2, following which she was taken to Apollo Hospital for treatment.

211.title: Kim Kardashian walks off Ellen's show following prank with spider
211.article_body: American television personality Kim Kardashian walked off comedienne Ellen DeGeneres' show after the latter pranked her with a fake spider. Ellen pretended to throw a spider out of its container while Kim ran away saying, "You're not doing this to me, I'm never going to get over it." Kim then walked out of the set waving and saying, "Bye, everyone!"

212.title: Citigroup initiates 'buy' rating on Paytm, raises target price by 32%
212.article_body: Citigroup Research has initiated 'buy' rating on Paytm owner One97 Communications and raised its target price to ₹910/share, up 32% from its current levels. Paytm's stock price has dropped nearly 70% from its IPO price of ₹2,150 led by regulatory headwinds and concerns about profitability. "Paytm has several potential levers to drive scale and improve profitability substantially," Citigroup said.

213.title: Only when Deepika entered my life, she made me appreciate living it: Ranveer
213.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh said that he had zero work-life balance but things changed for the better. He added, "I had zero work-life balance for the longest time. It was only when Deepika (Padukone) came into my life that she made me appreciate living it." "She sits down with me and goes through my calendar to ensure the same," he said.

214.title: Tried to kill myself: Poonam after Munawar says mom died of suicide
214.article_body: Actress Poonam Pandey, who is a contestant on reality show 'Lock Upp', has revealed that she tried to kill herself many times. Poonam further said she saw herself in Munawar's mother as he had revealed that she suffered domestic abuse for years and that she wasn't happy. Munawar had revealed that his mother died of suicide.

215.title: No one realised how big IPL was going to become: Brendon McCullum
215.article_body: Recalling the first-ever IPL match in 2008, Brendon McCullum said no one realised how big the tournament was going to become. McCullum played for KKR in the first-ever match and scored an unbeaten 158 runs. Talking about his knock, he said, "It took me eight balls to start." McCullum remains the only KKR batter to score a century in IPL.

216.title: Microsoft joins e-commerce platform Udaan's $225 million debt round
216.article_body: E-commerce platform Udaan on Monday said Microsoft Corporation has joined its $225 million fundraising through sale of convertible debt. In an email to employees, Udaan CFO Aditya Pande said the firm's plan of mandatorily convertible notes to IPO highlights Udaan's capital strategy's evolution. The notes will be converted into equity when Udaan raises funds next or during its planned IPO.

217.title: Sri Lankan Prez appoints 17 ministers amid anti-govt protests
217.article_body: Sri Lanka's President Gotabaya Rajapaksa on Monday appointed 17 Cabinet ministers amid the anti-government protests owing to the economic crisis in the country. The new Cabinet reportedly has eight former ministers and several fresh entrants. This is the third Cabinet reshuffle in recent weeks. Earlier this month, as many as 26 ministers had resigned from the Cabinet.

218.title: Over 100 Islamist insurgents killed recently: Joint African forces
218.article_body: A joint military force of African countries, consisting of Nigeria, Niger and Cameroon, said on Sunday that they have killed over 100 Islamist insurgents in recent weeks. The killed insurgents included 10 commanders, it added. A joint task force spokesperson said that troops had entered deep into insurgent-controlled enclaves in Lake Chad area and recovered weapons, food and illicit drugs.

219.title: Wish you all the success, happiness: Suryakumar on Rahul's 30th birthday
219.article_body: Team India batter Suryakumar Yadav took to Twitter to wish teammate KL Rahul on his 30th birthday on Monday. "Happy Birthday to one of the kindest...wish you all the success and happiness brother. Looking forward to many more partnerships with you," he wrote. Cheteshwar Pujara tweeted, "[Rahul] have a year as swashbuckling as your game."

220.title: KTR to inaugurate Hyd's Bahadurpura flyover on Apr 19
220.article_body: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao will inaugurate the Bahadurpura flyover in Hyderabad on April 19. The six-lane flyover from Bahadurpura Police Station to Nehru Zoological Park is expected to ease traffic congestion in the area. The flyover, which is a part of the Telangana government's Strategic Road Development Programme (SRDP), has been built at an estimated cost of ₹69 crore.

221.title: No attempt made to hoist saffron flag at mosque in Jahangirpuri: Police
221.article_body: Delhi Police Commissioner Rakesh Asthana on Monday said no attempt was made to hoist saffron flag at a mosque during the Hanuman Jayanti procession in Jahangirpuri on Saturday. "Some people are trying to disturb peace through the medium of social media," he said. The police chief added, "Legal action will be taken against those who are found spreading misinformation."

222.title: Hopefully, I start & finish here: Narine ahead of 150th match for KKR
222.article_body: Sunil Narine, who will play his 150th match for KKR against Rajasthan Royals today, has said, "I've always told Venky [Mysore, CEO]...hopefully, I don't play for any other franchise." "I've loved my stay at KKR, so hopefully I start and finish here," he added. Narine, who was bought by KKR in 2012, has taken 147 wickets in 140 IPL matches.

223.title: Spread teachings of gods in right way, don’t be 'andh bhakts': Maha CM
223.article_body: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray said people should spread the teachings of their gods in the right way rather than becoming "andh bhakts". "The true follower will understand the teaching of his God and spread it to all. The blind follower will only praise superficially and then sometimes change his affection," Thackeray added.

224.title: Gurugram civic body to start repairing Sector 28 roads next month
224.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Gurugram (MCG) plans to launch the repair of roads in Sector 28 next month, officials said on Sunday. The MCG has floated a tender worth ₹90 lakh for the work. Notably, a resident claimed that they have pursued the matter since 2013 and even pooled some money to repair a few stretches of the road.

225.title: Khurshid meets men who torched his home, says 'we decided to be friends'
225.article_body: Ex-Union Minister and Congress leader Salman Khurshid on Sunday shared a picture with the men who had set the entrance of his house on fire last year. "We talked and decided to be friends in peace. They felt bad about the event but went away pleased," said Khurshid. In November, Khurshid's Nainital house was vandalised amid controversy over his book.

226.title: Karisma Kapoor to star in Abhinay Deo's crime drama 'Brown'
226.article_body: Karisma Kapoor is set to play the lead role in a crime drama titled 'Brown'. The project, which is based on book 'City of Death' by Abheek Barua, will be directed by Abhinay Deo, who has previously helmed films like 'Delhi Belly' and 'Force 2'. Karisma took to Instagram to share some pictures from set and wrote, "To new beginnings."

227.title: Moving in small Mumbai flat was challenge, mother couldn't 'breathe': Poonam
227.article_body: Actress Poonam Dhillon said that moving into a small flat in Mumbai was a challenge after living in Chandigarh. "Initially, my mother said she couldn't 'breathe' in Mumbai...In Chandigarh...I biked to school, to the swimming club and elsewhere. I hadn't seen local trains or buses. The infrastructure of the city and the population was a kind of shock," she added.

228.title: South Korean band BTS' new album to release on June 10
228.article_body: South Korean boy band BTS' new album will release on June 10, the band's agency Big Hit Music said in a statement. "Details on the new album will be provided in a separate notice at a later date," the statement further read. In a teaser video posted on social media, BTS announced the album with the tagline 'We Are Bulletproof'.

229.title: Navi Mumbai corporator holds 'chai pe charcha' with citizens
229.article_body: Navi Mumbai corporator Vikrant Patil held 'chai pe charcha' to discuss issues faced by local residents. He held discussions on various issues such as roads, nallas, parks, municipal works, jobs and admissions in schools and colleges. A large number of citizens attended the event held at Patil's office.

230.title: Man dies by suicide after killing his family in UP's Ghazipur
230.article_body: A 35-year-old man allegedly died by suicide after killing his wife and two children in the Sadat Bazaar area of Ghazipur in Uttar Pradesh. According to the local police sub-inspector Mahendra Yadav, the accused, identified as Shivdas Sonekar, killed his wife Reena (30) and two children, aged five and three years, by smothering them with a pillow.

231.title: Amway India's assets worth ₹758 crore attached by ED over pyramid fraud
231.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has attached assets worth ₹757.77 crore belonging to Amway India Enterprises Private Limited. According to ED, the firm was running a pyramid fraud in the guise of direct selling multi-level marketing networks. The attached properties include Amway's land and factory building in Tamil Nadu's Dindigul district, plant and machinery, vehicles, bank accounts and FDs.

232.title: Javed Miandad was the first batsman to win an ODI with last-ball six
232.article_body: Former Pakistani captain Javed Miandad was the first-ever batsman to help his team win an ODI by hitting a six off the match's last ball. Miandad achieved the feat against India on April 18, 1986 by hitting a maximum on the bowling of then 20-year-old fast bowler Chetan Sharma. Pakistan won that match by one wicket.

233.title: Told Nike this was not on: Rai on women cricketers' jerseys being made from men's kits
233.article_body: Ex-CoA Chairman Vinod Rai, in a recent interview, said that women cricketers had not been taken seriously in India till around 2006. He added, "I was aghast to know...men's uniforms were being cut up and re-stitched for women's players. I had to ring up Nike and tell them that this wasn't on and that their design would be different."

234.title: Sensex crashes 1,170 points to end at 57,166 dragged by IT stocks
234.article_body: The Sensex plunged 1,172 points on Monday to close at 57,166, while the Nifty fell 302 points to end below 17,200, at 17,173. Most sectoral indices were trading lower today with the IT index declining nearly 5%, and realty and bank indices down 1% each. Infosys, HDFC Bank, Tech Mahindra and Apollo Hospitals were among the top Nifty losers.

235.title: Hyderabad's 216-year-old heritage monument to be reopened for public in May
235.article_body: The 216-year-old British Residency in Hyderabad will be reopened for the public in May, state Archaeology Minister V Srinivas Goud announced. According to the local heritage activists, since 2013, the monument was undergoing restoration work which was taken up by the World Monuments Fund. Notably, the residency served as a seat of power for the British in Hyderabad before independence.

236.title: Will target Israel's heart if it acts against Iran: Prez Raisi
236.article_body: Iran's President Ebrahim Raisi has warned Israel of a military response if it acts against the Islamic nation. "If you [Israel] take the slightest move against our nation, our armed forces will target the heart of the Zionist regime," said Raisi. This comes after Israel said it will not accept Iran as "a nuclear threshold state".

237.title: I don't own a home, I stay at friends' places: World's richest man Elon Musk
237.article_body: Elon Musk, the world's richest person with a net worth of over $250 billion, said, "I don't even own a home right now...I'm literally staying at friends' places." He added, "If I travel to the Bay Area, which is where most of Tesla engineering is, I basically rotate through friends' spare bedrooms." Musk also said, "I don't have a yacht."

238.title: Miller played shots from the top of the cover vs CSK, he'll be dangerous: Sachin
238.article_body: Talking about GT batter David Miller's unbeaten 94-run innings against CSK, Sachin Tendulkar said if the South Africa batter's "good phase" continues, then he'll be a very dangerous batter in the ongoing IPL season. "Because he played most of his game towards mid-wicket. He played shots from the top of the cover, which means he's absolutely in control," explained Tendulkar.

239.title: Bhuvneshwar Kumar becomes first Indian fast bowler to take 150 wickets in IPL
239.article_body: SRH fast bowler Bhuvneshwar Kumar has become the first Indian fast bowler to take 150 wickets in IPL. The 32-year-old achieved the feat after registering figures of 4-0-22-3 against PBKS on Sunday. Jasprit Bumrah is the second highest wicket-taker in IPL among Indian fast bowler with 134 scalps. Bhuvneshwar and Bumrah are followed by Umesh Yadav with 129 wickets.

240.title: Only hundred by a KKR player was hit in the 1st-ever IPL match
240.article_body: Brendon McCullum smashed the only hundred by a KKR player in the first-ever IPL match against RCB at Chinnaswamy Stadium, Bengaluru on April 18, 2008. He slammed 158* off 73 balls, including 13 sixes and 10 fours. It remained the highest IPL score till Chris Gayle slammed 175*(66) against PWI in 2013.

241.title: I'm married: Prince after Azma comments on his past equation with Nora Fatehi
241.article_body: In a new promo, 'Lock Upp' contestant Azma Fallah was seen making a comment about Prince Narula's equation with Nora Fatehi from the time they appeared together on 'Bigg Boss 9'. She said, "Prince Narula didn't get...attention from Nora Fatehi." Reacting to Azma's comment, Prince said, "It'll be...bad if you get personal again. I'm a married man. Shut up."

242.title: Every IPL season, Samson starts with a bang & then just tapers off: Aakash
242.article_body: Aakash Chopra has opined that Rajasthan Royals skipper Sanju Samson needs to play a captain's knock in the ongoing IPL 2022. "Every season, Samson starts with a bang and then just tapers off," Aakash stated. "Time has come for him to lift himself and the team as well," he added. Samson has scored 117 runs in five matches so far.

243.title: Ex-BJP ward member shot dead in Odisha; accused's family attacked
243.article_body: A 56-year-old former BJP ward member was shot dead following a dispute over a pond in Odisha's Dhenkanal on Sunday. In response, the victim's family, along with their supporters, attacked the accused's family and torched their house, causing serious injuries to accused's wife and three-year-old son, police said. Dhenkanal BJP leader Ramchandra Patra claimed it to be a political killing.

244.title: PBKS skipper Mayank is better, he should be ready to be back: Dhawan
244.article_body: Punjab Kings batter Shikhar Dhawan, speaking about skipper Mayank Agarwal's injury, has said, "Mayank is better and he should be ready to be back." Mayank did not feature in the match against SunRisers Hyderabad due to a toe injury and Dhawan was named the stand-in captain. SRH defeated Punjab in the match by seven wickets.

245.title: Dhoni's mindset was to look at team, never dwelled on his own performance: Gary Kirsten
245.article_body: Ex-India coach Gary Kirsten has called ex-India captain MS Dhoni the "ultimate team player". Kirsten added, "As a captain, Dhoni's mindset was always to look at the team first and see the way the team could be thriving. He never dwelled on his own performances." It was during Gary's stint with Dhoni that India won the 2011 World Cup.

246.title: Hyd Police seize ganja worth ₹1 crore, arrest 2 suspected peddlers
246.article_body: Hyderabad’s Rachakonda Police on Friday arrested two suspected interstate drug traffickers and seized 700 kg ganja worth ₹1 crore from their possession. Police intercepted the lorry carrying the contraband, which was en route to Rajasthan from Andhra Pradesh, near Hyderabad. The drugs were concealed inside the lorry, which was loaded with plywood and home decor sheets, reports stated.

247.title: Was signed as lead in 'Kumkum Bhagya', was very adamant to play it: Mrunal
247.article_body: Actress Mrunal Thakur said she was signed to play the lead role in the television serial 'Kumkum Bhagya' but it eventually turned into the second lead space. "I realised it didn't matter because I still won immense popularity...What matters is what impact you leave on audience...whosoever is the lead character...at times, other characters are ones with more drama," she added.

248.title: UP makes face masks compulsory in Lucknow, NCR amid COVID-19 surge
248.article_body: In view of the increase in COVID-19 cases in India, the Uttar Pradesh government on Monday made it mandatory for people to wear a face mask in public places in the capital city of Lucknow and six NCR districts. People in Gautam Buddha Nagar, Ghaziabad, Hapur, Meerut, Bulandshahr and Baghpat will also have to compulsorily wear face masks.

249.title: Shakti Kapoor shares pic with Ranjeet and Asrani among others
249.article_body: Veteran actor Shakti Kapoor on Monday took to Instagram to share a picture with veteran actors Ranjeet, Dilip Joshi, Rakesh Bedi, Puneet Issar and Asrani. He captioned the picture, "Last eve was nice meeting old friends." A social media user commented on Shakti's post, "Peripona to all our legends," while another one wrote, "Fantastic frame of friendship."

250.title: Enjoyed my debut game for Sussex: Pujara on 201* in county cricket
250.article_body: India batter Cheteshwar Pujara, who scored a double ton in County Championship Division Two, said he enjoyed his debut game for Sussex and was glad to contribute to the team's cause. In response to Derbyshire's 505 first-innings total, Sussex got bundled out for 174 before Pujara (201*) and Tom Haines (243) scored double tons to draw the match.

251.title: Good governance begins in the founders' heads: Info Edge Founder
251.article_body: Info Edge Founder Sanjeev Bikhchandani tweeted, "Good governance begins in the founders' heads. No amount of oversight...can ensure a company is well governed if the founders are not committed." He added, "If you are better governed, you will sleep more peacefully at night." Bikhchandani's comments come after Sequoia Capital India published a blog on the need for better corporate governance.

252.title: Tribal woman out to collect vegetables in forest attacked by bear in Tripura
252.article_body: A 45-year-old tribal woman was attacked by a wild bear in Tripura when she went into a forest area to collect tubers and vegetables. Reports said local youth spotted the woman and shifted her to a local hospital. One of her neighbours said that she was bleeding profusely. She suffered cuts on her face and other parts of her body.

253.title: Torture chambers built by Russian troops in southern Ukraine: Zelenskyy
253.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Sunday said Russian troops in southern Ukraine have been carrying out torture and kidnappings. "Torture chambers are built there. They abduct representatives of local governments and anyone deemed visible to local communities," he said in an address to the nation. Zelenskyy said that humanitarian aid has been stolen, creating famine.

254.title: Swiggy, Zomato back startup UrbanPiper in $24 mn funding round
254.article_body: Restaurant management platform UrbanPiper has raised $24 million in a funding round led by existing investors Sequoia Capital India and Tiger Global, along with new investors Swiggy and Zomato. The Bengaluru-based startup is a B2B software platform with over 27,000 hotels and restaurants live on its platform. UrbanPiper claims to process 18% of all online food orders in India.

255.title: Can't wait for the exceptional ride: Johar on trailer of Ajay's 'Runway 34'
255.article_body: Karan Johar has praised the trailer of Ajay Devgn's upcoming film 'Runway 34', writing on Twitter, "Breathtaking and thrilling." "Cannot wait for the exceptional ride...An intriguing edge of the seat story and the perfect summer film," he added. Ajay thanked Karan and wrote, "That's a really cool compliment...I would like for you to see the film, when...first copy is out."

256.title: 50 Russian artists' paintings stuck in S Korea due to sanctions
256.article_body: Paintings by around 50 Russian artists which were loaned to Sejong Museum of Art in South Korea's Seoul are stuck there due to sanctions imposed by multiple countries amid Russia-Ukraine conflict, organisers said on Monday. The situation has been caused as all flights to Moscow have been shut due to sanctions, AFP reported. The paintings were loaned for an exhibition.

257.title: L&T Infotech, Mindtree may merge into a $22 billion firm: Report
257.article_body: Larsen & Toubro is considering a merger between its publicly traded software firms, Larsen & Toubro Infotech and Mindtree, to create a $22 billion firm, Bloomberg reported. The boards of the two companies could consider share swap ratios for the merger as early as next week. L&T acquired Mindtree in 2019 and holds about a 61% stake in the company.

258.title: Fresh stone-pelting in Jahangirpuri, police attacked by relatives of accused
258.article_body: Stones were pelted at a police team on Monday near the site of Saturday's communal violence in Delhi's Jahangirpuri. As per police, family members of an accused pelted two stones at the team when they went to question them and one person has been detained. As many as 23 people have so far been arrested in connection to Saturday's incident.

259.title: Anywhere with you: Athiya Shetty wishes boyfriend KL Rahul on b'day
259.article_body: Actress Athiya Shetty wished her boyfriend, cricketer KL Rahul on his 30th birthday. Taking to Instagram, Athiya posted several monochrome photos of them. In the first picture, Athiya is seen holding KL Rahul as they posed for the camera. Alongside the post, she wrote, "Anywhere with you, happy birthday." Reacting to the post, KL Rahul commented, "Love you."

260.title: Byculla Zoo sees 50,000 visitors over long weekend, collects ₹24 lakh
260.article_body: Nearly 50,000 people visited the Byculla Zoo in Mumbai over the long weekend and it earned a revenue of over ₹24 lakh, officials said. Around 20,478 people came to the zoo on Sunday alone. The zoo, which is open from 9.30 am to 5 pm on all days, charges an entry fee of ₹50 per person.

261.title: ₹48,000 cr wiped off Infosys' m-cap in a day as shares plunge the most in 2 years
261.article_body: The shares of Infosys plunged over 9% on Monday during the intra-day trade, wiping out ₹48,000 crore from the company's market capital. At 9%, Infosys stock had the biggest fall in the market since March 23, 2020. This comes after several analysts cut Infosys margin estimates over its weaker-than-expected earnings for the March quarter.

262.title: Manish Sisodia shares Guj govt schools' pics 'without desks', 'broken toilets'
262.article_body: Ahead of PM Narendra Modi’s visit to Gujarat, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia tweeted pictures of government schools in Gujarat "without desks" and "broken toilets". "Dear PM, you may not see the pictures of these schools from the modern centre of Vidya Samiksha Kendra, where there is no desk to sit, there are spider webs...Toilets are broken," Sisodia tweeted.

263.title: 16 wagons of goods train derail in Punjab's Rupnagar
263.article_body: A train with 16 wagons, that was coming from Ropar Thermal Plant, derailed in Punjab's Rupnagar. The incident took place after driver applied brakes suddenly after a herd of cattle came on the railway tracks. DRM Ambala said that few express and passenger trains have been cancelled after the incident.

264.title: We didn't capitalise on what was a very good base while batting: Fleming
264.article_body: CSK head coach Stephen Fleming said they couldn't capitalise in the last five overs while batting against GT on Sunday. Fleming added, "Two contributing factors [towards our defeat] were outstanding innings from David Miller and a very good cameo from Rashid Khan." He further said, "It's a hard one...we were in control...so, losing from there is very hard."

265.title: Both murders were planned: Kerala ADGP on SDPI & RSS workers' killings
265.article_body: After an SDPI worker and an RSS worker were killed in Kerala's Palakkad, ADGP Law and Order, Vijay Sakhare, on Monday said that undoubtedly, both the murders were "planned". "There was a conspiracy behind both the murders. We have a fair idea about who are the accused persons," Sakhare added. "The suspects will be caught soon," Sakhare stated.

266.title: WPI inflation rises to record 14.55% in Mar, Govt cites Russia-Ukraine war as reason
266.article_body: India's Wholesale Price-based Inflation (WPI) has surged to a record high of 14.55% in March. The Centre has said that the high rate of inflation in March is due to "the rise in prices of crude petroleum and natural gas, mineral oils, basic metals" caused by the Russia-Ukraine conflict. Notably, In March 2021, the WPI was 7.89%.

267.title: Umran's pace means I'm a target, batters think I'm slower: Bhuvneshwar
267.article_body: On being asked how his SRH teammate Umran Malik's pace has helped him in the ongoing IPL, veteran pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar jokingly said, "More than helping me...I'm a target as batters think I'm slower." Bhuvneshwar also praised Umran, stating that watching the 22-year-old in action is "joy". "Hope the [batters] going after me leads to wickets...not boundaries," he added.

268.title: VHP’s Surendra Jain seeks NIA probe into Jahangirpuri violence
268.article_body: VHP’s Surendra Jain has demanded a probe by the NIA into the Jahangirpuri violence that took place in Delhi on Hanuman Jayanti. "Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has become the sleeper cell of terrorists today. My demand is from the Central government that an investigation should be done by the NIA because it involves the issue of national security," Jain added.

269.title: 2 killed as BJP MLA's Scorpio rams into motorcycle in UP's Lakhimpur Kheri
269.article_body: Two men were killed when their motorcycle and a Scorpio car collided head-on in Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri, police said. Police added that the Scorpio car is said to belong to Lakhimpur Kheri Sadar MLA Yogesh Verma. Reports said that the SUV is registered in the name of MLA's wife Neelam Verma. Police took the Scorpio driver into its custody.

270.title: Rescued tiger jumps into water during release in Sundarbans, old video resurfaces
270.article_body: IFS Officer Parveen Kaswan on Sunday shared an old video that captured the release of a rescued tiger that jumped and swam away from a boat in Sundarbans. Sharing the video, he wrote, "That tiger sized jump though." A user commented on the video, "Reminds me of Life of Pi!" Another tweeted, "It's swimming like an expert fish."

271.title: Grammy-winning singer Jon Batiste to make acting debut with The Color Purple
271.article_body: Multiple Grammy-winning singer Jon Batiste is set to make his feature acting debut with 'The Color Purple'. Blitz Bazawule, the filmmaker behind Beyoncé's 'Black Is King', will direct the upcoming project. In addition to Batiste, 'The Color Purple' will also feature Taraji P. Henson, Fantasia Barrino, Danielle Brooks, Colman Domingo, Corey Hawkins and others.

272.title: Man who set self on fire at Punjab police station dies; 11 booked
272.article_body: Eleven people, including a municipal councillor, have been booked after a 35-year-old man who set himself on fire at a police station in Punjab's Kapurthala died at a hospital on Sunday, police said. The deceased had claimed that the officials aren't acting on his complaint about his wife not being allowed to leave prostitution. The incident had occurred last week.

273.title: Which cricketers have bowled 20th over of an innings as maiden in IPL history?
273.article_body: SRH pacer Umran Malik became the fourth bowler to record the 20th over of an innings as maiden in IPL after conceding no runs and taking three wickets in PBKS' 20th over. Irfan Pathan bowled the 20th over as maiden, while representing KXIP against MI in 2008. Other bowlers to do so are Lasith Malinga (2009) and Jaydev Unadkat (2017).

274.title: Sleeper cells trained by police: Kerala BJP Vice President on RSS worker’s killing
274.article_body: Kerala BJP Vice President KS Radhakrishnan claimed that there are "sleeper cells" in the police force receiving training from police and armed forces. His remark came after an RSS worker was killed in Palakkad. "Primary duty of the state is to protect the life and property of citizens. But a murder happened within the vicinity of the police," Radhakrishnan added.

275.title: Car returning from marriage party hits truck in Amethi; 6 dead, 4 injured
275.article_body: A Bolero car returning from a wedding ceremony collided with a truck in Amethi, Uttar Pradesh on Sunday. According to SP Dinesh Singh, the accident, which took place around midnight in the Gauriganj area, claimed the lives of six people, including an 8-year-old boy, and injured four. Notably, the Bolero was returning from Rae Bareli's Nasirabad area, police said.

276.title: Man clicks obscene pics of wife, circulates them in B'luru; booked
276.article_body: A man has been booked for allegedly taking obscene pictures of his wife and blackmailing her in Bengaluru, police said on Monday. The man had reportedly demanded that his wife give him money and when she refused, he circulated the pictures to his friends. The complainant claimed that the accused had also tortured her to sleep with his friend.

277.title: Was surprised Sonu Sood knew about me; it was a fan moment: Karan Kundrra
277.article_body: Karan Kundrra reacted after actor Sonu Sood praised him by calling him "a tough guy". In an interview, replying to a question on Neha and Karan, Sonu said, "Karan Kundrra is more bad***...I'd say he's a tough guy." Reacting to it, Karan tweeted, "I didn't even know...Sonu paaji (brother) knew who I was...this [was] like a fan moment for me."

278.title: What is the state-wise active COVID-19 case tally as daily cases jump nearly 90%?
278.article_body: India recorded 2,183 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, an 89.8% jump from 1,150 cases reported a day before. In terms of active COVID-19 cases, Kerala has 2,466 cases, Delhi has 1,518, Karnataka has 1,506 and Assam has 1,349. While Haryana has 911 active cases, it is followed by Maharashtra with 646 cases and Uttar Pradesh with 610 cases.

279.title: Burglars enter Pune house via exhaust fan window, steal items worth Rs 86,000
279.article_body: Tanmay Kulkarni from Pune has lodged an FIR in a case where burglars entered his house, which is in front of a police station, through exhaust fan window and stole valuables worth ₹86,000, including some gold ornaments, a music system, laptop, and iPod. Police, in press release, said that Kulkarni had gone out with his wife when burglars entered house.

280.title: 27-year-old history-sheeter arrested in Mumbai; pistol, knives seized
280.article_body: A history-sheeter (27), accused in an October 2020 murder case, was arrested by the Mumbai Crime Branch's Unit-7 in Ghatkopar. The police seized a country-made pistol and two knives from the accused, who is identified as Amol Avate. He was allegedly involved in the murder of Ambadas Salve, a resident of Vikhroli (east), along with five other people, police said.

281.title: Hong Kong bans Air India flights till April 24 after 3 found COVID positive
281.article_body: Hong Kong has banned Air India services till April 24 after three passengers on one of its flights tested positive for COVID-19 post arrival on Saturday, an official said. "Due to restrictions imposed by Hong Kong authorities and limited demand on the sector, our flights to Hong Kong & back of 19th and 23rd April stand cancelled," Air India tweeted.

282.title: I don't remember seeing Dhoni losing too many games like this: Vaughan
282.article_body: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan questioned Ravindra Jadeja's captaincy after CSK's fifth loss in six games in the ongoing IPL season and said that he doesn't remember ex-captain MS Dhoni losing too many games like this. "Honestly, it wasn't a tight game [against GT] and they lost it. They should've easily won that game by 10 or 15 runs," he added.

283.title: Pujara smashes double hundred on Sussex debut, ends 52-innings century drought
283.article_body: Indian batter Cheteshwar Pujara smashed 201*(387) against Derbyshire on his debut for Sussex in County Championship Division Two. With this, Pujara became only the second Indian to score a double century in the County Championship after Mohammed Azharuddin. Pujara smashed a first-class hundred after going 52 innings without a ton.

284.title: Intelligence system in Kerala has failed miserably: VD Satheesan
284.article_body: Kerala Leader of Opposition VD Satheesan has criticised the state's intelligence system in the wake of the last week's back-to-back political killings in Palakkad. "Attempts are being made in Kerala for communal polarization. The victims are ordinary people and the conspirators are laughing. The intelligence system in Kerala has failed miserably," the Congress leader said.

285.title: TN girl kills neighbour for jewellery, says 'parents didn't buy ornaments'
285.article_body: 17-year-old, class 12 girl student has been arrested for allegedly strangling her 76-year-old neighbour and stealing 21-sovereign gold from the woman's house in Tamil Nadu. The girl said she murdered the woman for jewellery because her parents are daily wagers and haven't bought gold ornaments to save for her wedding. Incident came to light when woman's daughter found her dead.

286.title: Shelling killed 18, injured 100 in Kharkiv in 4 days: Ukraine Prez
286.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Sunday said that Russia's shelling is "constant" in Kharkiv and 18 people were killed in the past four days due to it. He added that over 100 people were also injured due to the shelling in the same period. "This is nothing but deliberate terror: mortars, artillery against ordinary residential quarters," he further said.

287.title: 5 arrested for hoisting saffron flag on dargah in Gujarat
287.article_body: Five persons were arrested and a juvenile was detained for allegedly hoisting a saffron flag on a dargah during a Hanuman Jayanti procession in Gujarat's Veraval. According to police, when the procession was passing by Magrebisha Bapu's dargah, some men "entered the dargah premises and hoisted a 'bhagva' (saffron) flag on the roof of the toilet block".

288.title: Received ₹500 as my 1st pay for working as a hostess at a conference: Samantha
288.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu during a Q&A session on Instagram revealed that her first income was ₹500 which she had received as a hostess for an eight-hour shift at a conference in a hotel. She added that she was in Class 10 or 11 at that time. Born in Chennai, Samantha attended St Stephen's Matriculation School in Pallavaram.

289.title: Shiv Sena MLA Mangesh Kudalkar’s wife dies by suicide
289.article_body: Shiv Sena MLA Mangesh Kudalkar's wife died by suicide in Mumbai's Kurla on Sunday. The 42-year-old, Rajni Kudalkar, was reportedly found hanging in the kitchen of her house by a family member who called the police. The police said they are trying to find out the reason behind the incident and will record statements of the family members.

290.title: Manish Malhotra shares pic of Alia in her mehendi outfit that took 3,000 hours to make
290.article_body: Fashion designer Manish Malhotra shared a picture of Alia Bhatt wearing her mehendi outfit that took 3,000 hours to make. "Alia...chose to personalise [the] ensemble with...sustainable approach...where approximately 180 textiles patches come together to mark her momentous occasion," he wrote. "The custom touches reminisce about her journey and depict symbolic elements of her memories," he added.

291.title: TV actor Vivian to marry ex-journalist from Egypt, 5 years after his split with Vahbiz
291.article_body: TV actor Vivian Dsena has revealed that he is planning to tie the knot with Nouran Aly, a former journalist from Egypt. "We first interacted around four-and-a-half years ago, when she contacted me for an interview," Vivian said. Vivian was earlier married to TV actress Vahbiz Dorabjee. They split five years ago and finalised their divorce in December 2021.

292.title: Blue is the only jersey missing: Harbhajan on SRH pacer Umran Malik
292.article_body: Harbhajan Singh has termed SRH's 22-year-old pacer Umran Malik as the "most deserving one" among the uncapped players to be selected for India's squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup. "Blue is the only jersey missing and he should get it early...He could be your match-winner [in Australia]," stated Harbhajan. Umran has picked nine wickets in six games this season.

293.title: Attacks on processions designed way to divide country: JP Nadda
293.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda on Sunday said that the Congress party is behaving in the most irresponsible manner. Addressing the party workers in Karnataka's Hosapete, Nadda said, "You must have seen the attacks on Ram Navami procession or something else at some other place...I can say it's a designed way to divide the country," Nadda added.

294.title: Rahul Gandhi lacks stability, can't be entrusted with responsibilities: PJ Kurien
294.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi is a leader who has “no stability” and cannot be entrusted with responsibilities, senior party leader PJ Kurien said. "The captain cannot leave the ship when it is in trouble. After the 2019 elections, he resigned abruptly from the post (of Congress chief). But, he continues to take important decisions in the party," Kurien added.

295.title: Met Salman as kid; he was eating from tandoor, mom made us stand with him: Neha
295.article_body: Singer Neha Bhasin said that she first met actor Salman Khan when she was a child. In an interview with Bollywood Hungama, she said that she has picture of the meeting and that Salman was standing near a tandoor and eating something from it. "My mom made us stand with him. Me and my sister were looking silly," she added.

296.title: Aamir dances to Dhol Jageero Da with influencer Ruhee Dosani, she shares video
296.article_body: Social media influencer Ruhee Dosani took to Instagram to share a video of herself dancing with Aamir Khan to the song 'Dhol Jageero Da'. Aamir had invited Ruhee and her family to his house. "Still don't know how to...process the fact that Aamir sir was so kind to agree to spend time with my family to celebrate Vaisakhi," Ruhee wrote.

297.title: 2 killed, 17 injured in separate shootings in US
297.article_body: Two people were killed and at least 17 injured in two separate incidents of mass shooting in US over the Easter weekend. A shooting at a nightclub in South Carolina left nine people injured, while another in Pittsburgh left two dead and eight wounded. These happened a day after 14 people were injured in a shooting incident in South Carolina.

298.title: After silver, Madhavan's son Vedaant wins gold at Danish Open; actor shares video
298.article_body: Actor R Madhavan's son Vedaant has bagged a gold medal in swimming at the Danish Open 2022. Vedaant won the medal in the 800 m swimming event and clocked 8:17:28. Sharing a video of the felicitation ceremony, Madhavan wrote, "GOLD….With all your blessings and God's greatest...winning streak continues." Earlier, he had won a silver medal in a different category.

299.title: 'Social Media Lab' activated in Maha, 3,000 posts inciting communal tensions deleted
299.article_body: Mumbai Police on Monday said that a 'Social Media Lab' has been activated to keep a vigil on posts that could incite communal tensions in Maharashtra. Mumbai Police added that around 3,000 such posts have been deleted till now. Notably, Maharashtra government has decided to allow the use of loudspeakers at religious sites only with due permission, ANI reported.

300.title: Prince Narula to enter Kangana Ranaut's show 'Lock Upp'
300.article_body: Prince Narula is all set to enter Kangana Ranaut-hosted show 'Lock Upp'. The actor, who had earlier won 'Bigg Boss 9' and 'Roadies 12', said, "I am entering the show as a troublemaker and not a contestant." "I am very excited. Lock Upp is a different show...My main reason to enter this show is that it is judgment-free," Prince added.

301.title: Delhi Capitals under quarantine following COVID-19 scare: Reports
301.article_body: Delhi Capitals (DC) have cancelled their scheduled travel to Pune ahead of their next IPL 2022 match amid COVID-19 scare, Cricbuzz reported. Their players and support staff will be quarantined in their rooms, the report added. DC's physio Patrick Farhart had tested positive for the virus. As per reports, a player has now tested positive following a Rapid Antigen Test.

302.title: Akash Singh wins 'Hunarbaaz...' trophy, ₹15 lakh prize; says 'it feels surreal'
302.article_body: Akash Singh has become the first winner of 'Hunarbaaz Desh Ki Shaan' and bagged a trophy and cash prize of ₹15 lakh. Speaking about winning the show, Akash said, "I can't find the words to express the emotions...I'm going through, and it...feels so surreal!" "I want to thank my family and friends for...supporting me in this life-changing journey," he added.

303.title: Police shoot 3 after riots break out over Quran burning in Sweden
303.article_body: Three people were shot and injured by police in Sweden's Norrkoping city after riots broke out following reports of burning of the Quran by a politician. "Three people seem to have been hit by ricochets and are now being cared for in hospital. All three injured are arrested on suspicion of crime," said police, adding, the injuries were not life-threatening.

304.title: I still get messages about 'October', how it changed someone's life: Banita
304.article_body: Actress Banita Sandhu said that she still gets messages about her movie 'October'. " And [about] how it moved them deeply or changed someone's life. It is really gratifying as an artist to be a part of a film that is so timeless that it still speaks to audiences years later," she said, adding she looks up to Deepika Padukone.

305.title: Man beats partner's 3-year-old daughter to death in Pune; arrested
305.article_body: A man has been arrested for allegedly beating his partner's three-year-old daughter to death in Pune. "Our preliminary probe suggests that the accused resented the child since she was born out of a previous relationship," an officer said. According to the FIR, the man banged the child's head against the wall. The girl's mother filed a complaint last week.

306.title: 19 arrested as road accident causes communal clashes in Guj; 3 hurt
306.article_body: As many as 19 people have been arrested after a minor road accident between people from two communities caused clashes in Gujarat's Vadodara, the police said on Monday. The miscreants pelted stones, damaged vehicles and also vandalised a shrine, the police added. Three people who were injured have been admitted to a hospital, the city's Police Commissioner Shamsher Singh said.

307.title: Comedian Munawar Faruqui reveals his mother died by suicide in 2007
307.article_body: Comedian Munawar Faruqui, in an episode of 'Lock Upp', revealed his mother died by suicide in 2007.  "I always think things may have been different had I slept with my mom that night...had I reached the hospital earlier," he said. "For 22 years of her married life...my mom wasn't happy. All my life...I saw her being beaten up," he added.

308.title: 16-yr-old boy gets 36 stitches as 2 men stab him after failed robbery attempt
308.article_body: A 16-year-old boy received 36 stitches after two bike-borne men stabbed him after a failed robbery attempt in Bengaluru. The  robbers were following the victim when he was returning home from an eatery. They stopped boy to ask for his valuables. When he denied having anything, robbers forcefully stripped him. When the boy resisted, they stabbed him and ran away.

309.title: Infosys shares fall 9% in intra-day trade post Q4 results, its biggest fall in 2 yrs
309.article_body: Infosys' shares dropped 9% to ₹1592.05 on the BSE in Monday's intra-day trade owing to its weak Q4 results, making this its biggest fall in the market in two years. The plunge wiped out ₹47,907.7 crore from its market valuation. Earlier on March 23, 2020, Infosys plunged 12% in the intra-day trade on the BSE.

310.title: Stunning partnership: Raina on Ruturaj, Rayudu adding 92 runs vs GT
310.article_body: Ex-CSK batter Suresh Raina took to Twitter to praise CSK batters Ruturaj Gaikwad and Ambati Rayudu for adding 92 runs for the third wicket against GT. Raina also congratulated Rayudu for crossing the 4000-run mark in the IPL. "It was so great to see such a stunning partnership," he tweeted. Ruturaj smashed 73(48) while Rayudu scored 46(31) in the game.

311.title: Zoya Akhtar's 'Archies' starring Suhana, Khushi & Agastya goes on floor
311.article_body: Filmmaker Zoya Akhtar on Monday began shooting for her upcoming Netflix live-action musical film 'The Archies'. The film reportedly features Shah Rukh Khan's daughter Suhana Khan, Boney Kapoor's daughter Khushi Kapoor and Amitabh Bachchan's grandson Agastya Nanda in the lead roles. Sharing a picture of a clapboard, producer Reema Kagti wrote, "Archie's shoot starts."

312.title: Punjab officer to give part of salary to daughters of farmers dying by suicide
312.article_body: Senior Superintendent of Police, Mandeep Singh Sidhu has decided to contribute part of his salary for education of daughters of farmers who die by suicide. Sidhu has been posted in Sangrur for the third time and decided to contribute Rs 51,000 from his first pay followed by Rs 21,000 every month till the time he is posted in the area.

313.title: 3 men arrested for ATM fraud in Ludhiana, 31 cards recovered
313.article_body: Three men were arrested on Sunday, two days after a woman’s debit card was swapped with a fake one at an ATM on Sua Road, Ludhiana. As many as 31 stolen cards were recovered from them. "The accused would target ATMs without a security guard, and offer to help those facing trouble carrying out transactions," ADCP, BS Randhawa, said.

314.title: Permission needed to use loudspeakers at religious sites: Maharashtra govt
314.article_body: Maharashtra has decided to allow the use of loudspeakers at religious sites only with due permission, reported ANI. State Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil will hold a meeting with the DGP to instruct him to direct police commissioners and officers on this on Monday. It comes after MNS chief Raj Thackeray gave May 3 as ultimatum to remove mosque loudspeakers.

315.title: Cong members booked for unlawful assembly at K'taka CM's B'luru home
315.article_body: A case has been filed against 36 Congress members, including former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah, state party chief DK Shivakumar and party General Secretary Randeep Singh Surjewala, in Bengaluru on charges of unlawful assembly at state CM Basavaraj Bommai's residence. The party members have been booked under IPC Sections 341, 143 and KP Act Section 103, the ANI reported.

316.title: SC cancels Ashish Mishra's bail in Lakhimpur case, asks him to surrender
316.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday cancelled the bail granted to Union Minister Ajay Mishra Teni's son Ashish Mishra, an accused in the Lakhimpur Kheri violence case. The top court has also asked Ashish to surrender within a week. Earlier, the SC had raised questions over the Allahabad High Court granting bail to Ashish on February 10.

317.title: That over was the game-changer: Miller on Rashid hitting Jordan for 3 sixes
317.article_body: GT batter David Miller, who scored 94* off 51 balls against CSK, said that their stand-in captain Rashid Khan's batting in their 18th over was the game-changing moment in the match. GT needed 48 in the last three overs when Rashid smashed Chris Jordan for three sixes and a four. Overall, GT scored 25 runs in the 18th over.

318.title: Rajkummar to reunite with Anubhav for anthology set against pandemic: Report
318.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao and filmmaker Anubhav Sinha are reportedly teaming up again, after 'Bheed', for an anthology that is set against the backdrop of COVID-19 pandemic. "The director felt Rajkummar is someone who connects with the movie on a personal level," report stated. The anthology will feature short films by Sudhir Mishra, Hansal Mehta, Ketan Mehta and other filmmakers.

319.title: 18-yr-old boxer Ali Tazeem, dubbed 'next Amir Khan', passes away in car accident in UK
319.article_body: UK's 18-year-old boxer Ali Tazeem, dubbed the 'next Amir Khan', passed away in a car accident. Tazeem had signed his professional contract with Probellum three weeks ago. Tazeem won 15 gold medals from 51 bouts as an amateur. "The skill-set he has...the movement...everything...reminds me of myself when I was younger," boxer Amir Khan had said about Ali.

320.title: Greater Noida sectors, called after Greek alphabets, to be renamed
320.article_body: The Greater Noida Authority is reportedly planning to rename the city's sectors that are currently called after Greek alphabets like Alpha, Beta, Gamma, Delta and Omicron. GNIDA said it is being done to streamline the city's "complex and mismanaged naming system". However, some residents said it may have something to do with the association of those alphabets with COVID-19 variants.

321.title: To the most amazing wife & mom: David Beckham on Victoria's b'day
321.article_body: Actor David Beckham wished his wife Victoria Beckham on her birthday. Taking to Instagram, he shared a throwback picture of them kissing and wrote, "Happy Birthday to the most amazing wife, mummy and businesswoman." He further wrote, "Have the most amazing day because you deserve to...We all love you so much."

322.title: Delhi Metro to expand its existing depots for Phase 4 sections
322.article_body: The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) has decided not to acquire additional land but will expand the capacity of the existing Mukundpur depot to meet the requirements of the upcoming stations of Phase IV. According to a DMRC official, the expansion will provide space for the extension of the Pink Line and the Magenta line.

323.title: Okinawa outlet in Tamil Nadu goes up in flames after electric scooter catches fire
323.article_body: An Okinawa dealership in Tamil Nadu went up in flames after an e-scooter parked in the outlet reportedly caught fire. While the entire showroom was gutted, no casualties were reported and the fire was put out with the help of locals. Before this incident, Okinawa announced a recall of 3,215 units of its 'Praise Pro' scooters to fix battery-related issues.

324.title: It is clear that BJP itself is behind Jahangirpuri violence: AAP
324.article_body: AAP on Sunday alleged that considering the recent events, it is "clear" that BJP is behind the violence that broke out in Delhi's Jahangirpuri. Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta had honoured "goons" who were arrested for vandalising the national capital's CM's residence, it said. "When you...honour such goons you send a message...that you're on the side of violence," it added.

325.title: COVID-19 positivity rate rises to 15% in Noida
325.article_body: With COVID-19 cases rising in the NCR, the positivity rate in Noida has reportedly increased to 15%. The authorities said that precautionary measures are being taken. "There is no need to panic yet. The active cases have increased but it is important to note that there is not a single person who has been hospitalised," said Gautam Buddha Nagar DM.

326.title: XYXX teams up with KL Rahul, says 'Tune out the noise to play your way'
326.article_body: XYXX has teamed up with KL Rahul aiming to break new boundaries with the 'Play Your Way' campaign. "In a world filled with fake news and hype, XYXX's game-changing campaign encourages everyone to listen to their inner voice, trust their instincts," KL Rahul said. XYXX designs products that seek to challenge the status quo in innerwear and comfort wear segment.

327.title: Shanghai reports first COVID-19 deaths since start of lockdown
327.article_body:
Shanghai has reported the first COVID-19 deaths since the start of its weeks-long lockdown.
Three people died on Sunday, according to Shanghai's municipal government. They were aged between 89 and 91, had underlying diseases and were all unvaccinated, according to reports. Shanghai reported more than 22,000 COVID-19 cases on Sunday.

328.title: Abhishek said he follows music passion in dad's basement set-up: Dasvi composer
328.article_body: One of the composers of the movie 'Dasvi', Sachin Sanghvi, said that actor Abhishek Bachchan told him and composer Jigar Saraiya that music has been a major part of his life. "He shared that Amitabh Bachchan sir has a small set-up in the basement of their residence where he still pursues music as a passion," Sachin added.

329.title: PM should directly intervene: RJD MP Manoj Jha on Delhi violence
329.article_body: RJD MP Manoj Jha has urged PM Narendra Modi to directly intervene and give a "strong message" in regards to the recent Jahangirpuri violence in Delhi. "The Jahangirpuri incident isn't isolated. If you look at the images of different places...then there is a pattern. I request PM for his direct intervention...give a strong message," Jha said.

330.title: Video shows thieves hitting woman with their car as she flees robbery in US
330.article_body: The US police have released a video that captured the moment when a woman, who was escaping from a robbery attempt, was hit by a car driven by thieves. It showed the accused jumping out of the car to snatch her watch after hitting her with their car. She was being followed after she left a jewellery store, police added.

331.title: People have not seen me in this kind of part: Sharad on 'Operation Romeo'
331.article_body: Sharad Kelkar, speaking about his upcoming project 'Operation Romeo', said that it's an important movie in his career as it'll give fans an opportunity to see him in a "gritty" role. "People haven't seen me in this kind of part so it's like reinvention," he added. Directed by Shashant Shah, the film is the remake of 2019 Malayalam film 'Ishq'.

332.title: CIA arrests 2 persons with pistol, live cartridges in Mohali
332.article_body: The Crime Investigation Agency (CIA) of Mohali district police arrested two persons and recovered a .315 bore pistol and two live cartridges from them. The accused allegedly came to the city to commit a crime. The police suspect that they could have links with some of the gangs operating in the state. Both the accused belong to the Hoshiarpur district.

333.title: India sees 2,183 new COVID-19 cases, 90% rise in daily cases
333.article_body: India has reported 2,183 new COVID-19 cases and 214 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Kerala reported 213 deaths including 151 deaths during the day and 62 reconciled deaths and Uttar Pradesh reported one death, according to government. It comes a day after the country saw 1,150 cases and four deaths.

334.title: Raghav gets legal notice for calling BJP 'Gundon-Lafangon ki party'
334.article_body: Punjab Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha leader Ashok Sareen sent a legal notice to AAP leader Raghav Chadha on Sunday for calling BJP "Gundon ki, Lafangon ki party" and "Bharat ki Zahil Party". The notice demanded that Chadha issue a written apology to Sareen and BJP within three days, failing which a civil and criminal complaint would be filed against him.

335.title: I needed to step up, take responsibility: Rashid on scoring 40(21) vs CSK
335.article_body: GT stand-in captain Rashid Khan said he wanted two batters to score big in their chase of CSK's 170-run target and he needed to step up and take the responsibility after they were reduced to 87/5 after 13 overs. Rashid scored 40 off 21 balls while David Miller smashed 94*(51) to help GT win the game by three wickets.

336.title: Chris Jordan gives away most runs by a CSK bowler in a match in IPL 2022
336.article_body: CSK's bowling all-rounder Chris Jordan gave away most runs by a CSK bowler in an IPL 2022 match after conceding 58 runs against GT. Jordan registered figures of 3.5-0-58-0. He conceded four sixes and five fours in his spell. Before Jordan, pacer Mukesh Choudhary had conceded the most runs (4-0-52-1) by a CSK bowler in an IPL 2022 match.

337.title: Sensex crashes 1,000 points in early trade, Nifty below 17,200
337.article_body: The Sensex tanked over 1,000 points in early trade on Monday while the NSE Nifty 50 dipped below 17,200 amid weak global cues. The indices reopened on April 18 after a gap of four straight days on account of public holidays. Infosys and HDFC Bank tanked 6% and 2.4% respectively, on account of their Q4 earnings.

338.title: Miller played a blinder, so did Rashid: GT's Abhinav Manohar on win vs CSK
338.article_body: GT batter Abhinav Manohar, who scored 12(12) against CSK, said he didn't move from his place when David Miller and stand-in captain Rashid Khan batted while chasing the 170-run target. "Miller played a blinder, and so did Rashid. I was sitting in the same place," he stated. Miller smashed 94*(51) while Rashid scored 40(21) to help GT defeat CSK.

339.title: BJP is trying to divide society: Kamal Nath on Khargone violence
339.article_body: Following the clashes that took place in MP’s Khargone, former MP CM and Congress leader Kamal Nath on Sunday said that BJP is trying to "divide" the society. "These riots that took place in Khargone are against the culture of our country. Our culture is to unite the society but BJP is trying to divide it," Nath added.

340.title: You've to be ready for rejections in Mumbai; wait is endless, crushing: Sonu
340.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood said that in a city like Mumbai, one has to be ready for a lot of rejections and people not giving dues. "The wait is endless, it is crushing and extremely demanding. That's when you need to survive and face those challenges. You just have to be there, patiently, waiting for your turn to shine," he added.

341.title: Mahesh Babu buys electric car Audi e-tron worth ₹1.19 crore, shares pic
341.article_body: Actor Mahesh Babu has bought electric car Audio e-tron which is worth around ₹1.19 crore. "Bringing a clean, green and sustainable future home," he wrote on Instagram while sharing a picture. The car is Audi's first all-electric model to be launched in India. The car is equipped with a 95 kWh battery pack and a dual motor setup.

342.title: Divyansh-Manuraj crowned winners of India's Got Talent Season 9, win ₹20-lakh cash prize
342.article_body: Beatboxer Divyansh and flautist Manuraj have been crowned the winners of India's Got Talent Season 9. The duo won a cash prize of ₹20 lakh and a car. First runner-up Ishita Vishwakarma and second runner-up Bomb Fire Crew took home cash prize of  ₹5 lakh each. Divyansh hails from Jaipur, while Manuraj is from Bharatpur.

343.title: RCB's Harshal Patel shares pic with sister who passed away, pens note
343.article_body: RCB all-rounder Harshal Patel took to Instagram to share a picture of himself with his sister who passed away during IPL 2022. He wrote, "Didi...You were one of the kindest and most joyful person in our lives. You faced incredible difficulties...with a big smile...till your last breath." He added, "I'll continue to do everything that made you proud of me."

344.title: 15-yr-old boy pushed into Mula river from Bopodi bridge in Pune
344.article_body: A 15-year-old boy was reportedly pushed into the Mula river from Bopodi railway bridge in Pune on Saturday. The accused was known to the victim, according to police. The victim's mother claimed that the accused told her son that he would show him parrot chicks under the bridge and then pushed him down. The boy was rescued by a boat.

345.title: I'll buy bulldozer someday, demolish stone-pelters' houses: Pundit Dhirendra
345.article_body: Pundit Dhirendra Krishna Shastri of Bageshwar Dham has reportedly urged Hindus to "demolish houses of stone-pelters". "Wake up, cowards! Demolish the houses of stone-pelters otherwise they'll come for you next," he said, adding, "If they pelt stones at your house, you bulldoze their houses. I'll also buy a bulldozer someday and demolish the houses of those stone-pelters."

346.title: Pune RTO revenue exceeded pre-pandemic level in 2021
346.article_body: The revenue of Pune's Regional Transport Office (RTO) exceeded the pre-COVID-19 pandemic level in 2021, according to government data. The revenue, mainly generated through vehicle registrations, reached ₹1,027 crore in 2021, up from ₹1,020 crore seen in 2019. "With the situation improving and curbs being relaxed, revenue generation has returned to normal," said an RTO officer.

347.title: 18-year-old table tennis player D Vishwa dies as 12-wheel trailer hits car
347.article_body: Deenadayalan Vishwa, one of the top Tamil Nadu table tennis players, passed away in a road accident on Sunday, while travelling by road from Guwahati to Shillong for the 83rd Senior National and Inter-State Table Tennis Championship. The accident reportedly occurred when the Swift Desire car in which the 18-year-old player was travelling was hit by a 12-wheel trailer.

348.title: My 2nd wife wanted me to quit DJing & be an actor: Lock Upp's Ali on divorce
348.article_body: On Sunday's episode of the reality show, 'Lock Upp', contestant Ali Mercchant revealed that he got married for the second time, in 2016 and got divorced in December 2021. Ali said his second wife did not want him to be a DJ. "She wanted me to quit DJing and be an actor...Our life philosophies did not match," he added.

349.title: These are all rumours: Jubin Nautiyal on dating Nikita Dutta
349.article_body: Singer Jubin Nautiyal has said that the reports of him dating actress Nikita Dutta are just rumours. "Nikita is a very, very dear friend of mine," he added. Jubin further said though his parents remained unfazed by the rumours, he had to spend a considerable amount of time explaining to his relatives that he hadn't gotten secretly engaged to Nikita.

350.title: Teen falls to death from waterfall while clicking selfie in Pune
350.article_body: Police and rescue teams on Sunday recovered the body of an 18-year-old boy, a day after he fell into Kund Mala waterfall in Pune while clicking a selfie. The body was found stuck in the water hyacinth and was retrieved, officials said. According to police, six students of Indira College, including the deceased, had gone to visit the waterfall.

351.title: Neetu shares pic with Ranbir & son-in-law Bharat; calls them her 'pillars'
351.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor took to Instagram to share a picture with her son, actor Ranbir Kapoor and her son-in-law Bharat Sahni.
