The picture was from Ranbir-Alia Bhatt's wedding ceremony. While sharing the post, she wrote, "My pillars." As soon as she posted the photo, fans took to the comments section, and wrote, "Congratulations Neetu ji." Another user wrote, "Two sons."

352.title: Man demands change of Indian flag at Bengaluru station, tags city police
352.article_body: A Twitter user has demanded changing of the Indian flag at the KSR Bengaluru Railway Station. "The flag appears to be damaged at the top," he wrote in his tweet. The Bengaluru Police replied to his tweet saying that they have forwarded his concern to the South Western Railway for any necessary action to be taken.

353.title: Shah Rukh Khan, Salman Khan attend Baba Siddique’s annual Iftaar party, pics surface
353.article_body: Actors Shah Rukh Khan, Salman Khan and Sanjay Dutt attended Indian politician Baba Siddique's annual Iftaar party at Hotel Taj Lands End in Mumbai's Bandra. Baba Siddique hosted the party after a gap of two years owing to the COVID-19 pandemic. Miss Universe 2021 Harnaaz Kaur Sandhu also attended the party.

354.title: Ravindra Jadeja gets angry at Shivam Dube over fielding, video goes viral
354.article_body: CSK captain Ravindra Jadeja got angry at Shivam Dube after he didn't attempt GT batter David Miller's catch in their IPL 2022 encounter on Sunday. Dube was fielding at deep mid-wicket in the 17th over bowled by Dwayne Bravo when Miller lofted the ball towards him. Jadeja almost threw his cap in anger as Dube didn't go for the catch.

355.title: Conor McGregor shares pics of his physical transformation over the years
355.article_body: Former UFC featherweight and lightweight champion Conor McGregor took to Instagram to share pictures of his physical transformation over the years. "Climb the ladder," he captioned the post. "That’s actually insane the way he was able to dominate different weight classes like that," a fan commented on the post. "2014-2016 was the golden age," another fan wrote.

356.title: Nepal considering 2-day holiday for govt offices to reduce fuel consumption
356.article_body: Nepal is considering declaring a two-day holiday in public offices this month to reduce fuel consumption as its prices surge. The Ukraine war has caused a spike in global oil prices as Russian oil faces sanctions. Amid its foreign exchange crisis, Nepal has urged its citizens living abroad to open dollar accounts in banks in the country and make investments.

357.title: Did well in 1st 6 overs, but failed to execute plans in last 5 vs GT: Jadeja
357.article_body: CSK captain Ravindra Jadeja said they failed to execute their plans in the last five overs while defending their 169-run total against GT on Sunday. "We started brilliantly...we did well in the first 6 overs...I thought Chris Jordan could execute his yorkers [in the final over]...but he couldn't do so," stated Jadeja. CSK lost the match by three wickets.

358.title: Man asks Hyd Police to allow guests in wedding, says 'food will be wasted'
358.article_body: A Twitter user shared a picture from his wedding and said that the Hyderabad Police were stopping guests "for some reason". "We have invited 700 people for our wedding happening now in Vedika convention centre, Jal Vihar...Kindly allow us to perform our wedding and [let] the guests enter and bless the couple else the food will be wasted," tweet read.

359.title: KGF is a horror film for Bollywood, they will have nightmares for years: RGV
359.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma took to Twitter to talk about KGF's success and said that it is a "horror film" for the Bollywood industry and they will have nightmares about its success for years to come. "@TheNameIsYash is literally machine gunning all...Bollywood stars opening collections and its final collections will be...nuclear bomb thrown on Bollywood from Sandalwood," he tweeted.

360.title: Anupam Kher shares pics showing his physical transformation; fans react
360.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher on Sunday took to Instagram to share pictures of his physical transformation. He wrote, "Your desire to change must be greater than your desire to stay the same! Being fit doesn’t begin in the gym with a dumbbell; it starts with a decision in your head!" Commenting on his post, a user wrote, "What a transformation sir!"

361.title: NCP MP Amol Kolhe dances at staffer's wedding in Pune, video surfaces
361.article_body: A video has surfaced that shows Nationalist Congress Party MP Amol Kolhe dancing on dhol beats at a wedding ceremony in Pune district of Maharashtra. Kolhe was reportedly dancing at the wedding of his staffer Tejas Zodage in Narayangaon. The Member of Parliament was wearing a white ethnic attire on the occasion.

362.title: David Miller smashes 94*(51) as GT hand CSK their 5th defeat in IPL 2022
362.article_body: GT batter David Miller smashed an unbeaten 94 off 51 deliveries as his team chased down the 170-run target in 19.5 overs against CSK. GT have now won five matches in IPL 2022, while CSK have now lost five out of their first six matches. CSK fast bowler Chris Jordan conceded 58 runs in 3.5 overs.

363.title: Aaditya Thackeray to visit Ram Temple site in Ayodhya in May
363.article_body: Maharashtra Tourism Minister Aaditya Thackeray will be on a one-day visit to UP's Ayodhya in the first week of May during which he'll be going to the Ram Janambhoomi site. This comes after MNS chief Raj Thackeray confirmed that he will visit Ayodhya on June 5. Notably, MNS and Shiv Sena are involved in a row over loudspeakers outside mosques.

364.title: Products of 30,000 small brands cater to 80% of population: Survey
364.article_body: A Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) survey showed household products of over 30,000 brands operating at small and medium scale cater to 80% of India's population. Big brands are in demand among people of higher and upper-middle classes, CAIT Secretary General Praveen Khandelwal said. "It's a myth that about 3,000 big brands...are catering to the people's needs," he added.

365.title: Was a strong performance: Williamson on SRH's win against PBKS
365.article_body: After SRH's seven-wicket win against PBKS in IPL 2022, SRH skipper Kane Williamson praised his team for putting "strong performance" at DY Patil Stadium. "So far, we've managed to put out some strong performances...we'll continue to try...improve and put out better ones," he stated. This is fourth consecutive win for SRH, which have taken them to fourth spot in standings.

366.title: J&K's Tulip Garden to shut a week early due to high temperature
366.article_body: The Tulip Garden in J&K's Srinagar which is one of its major tourist attractions will be closing on Monday, a week ahead of the usual time. "We are closing early this season as the bloom has reduced due to high temperatures," the garden's in-charge Sofi Inam-ur-Rehman said. The flowers require temperatures between 15 and 25 degrees Celsius to bloom.

367.title: Jet fuel price up 0.2%, touches all-time high after 2022's 8th hike
367.article_body: Price of aviation turbine fuel (ATF), or jet fuel, was hiked by 0.2% on Saturday to an all-time high on the back of rising global oil prices. ATF now costs ₹1,13,202.33/kl in Delhi, ₹1,11,981.99/kl in Mumbai and ₹1,17,753.6/kl in Kolkata. In eight hikes beginning January 1, ATF prices have been increased by ₹39,180.42, or almost 50%.

368.title: We were 30-40 runs short, lost many wickets early: Dhawan on PBKS' loss
368.article_body: PBKS stand-in captain Shikhar Dhawan said his side lost too many wickets early and were 30-40 runs short in their seven-wicket loss against SRH in IPL. "Once we lost too many wickets then we had to take the game deep," he added. PBKS were reduced to 61/4 after eight overs and lost five wickets on last seven balls of innings.

369.title: Delhi violence accused does Allu Arjun's 'Pushpa' gesture while being taken to court
369.article_body: A video has shown one of the accused in the Jahangirpuri Delhi violence case doing Allu Arjun's popular hand gesture from the movie 'Pushpa' while being taken to court on Sunday. In the video that is being widely shared online, one of the key accused Ansar was seen doing the signature move while smiling at the camera recording him.

370.title: Turkey condemns Israeli action against Palestinians in Jerusalem
370.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan on Sunday condemned the Israeli Police's action against the Palestinians during recent clashes inside Jerusalem's Al-Aqsa mosque compound. "Turkey always stands with Palestine," he added. Notably, Erdoğan's comments come amid efforts by Turkey and Israel in recent weeks to normalise their long-strained ties, according to Reuters.

371.title: Mahindra praises Mumbai's new bus stops with exercise bars, 'cool' green tops
371.article_body: Mahindra Group's Chairman Anand Mahindra on Saturday took to Twitter to share a video about 105 Mumbai bus stops that are set to be revamped. The new bus stops will be cleaner, safer, sleeker, and feature plant-covered roofs and exercise bars. "Terrific to also see innovative features like the exercise bar & the 'cool' green tops," Mahindra tweeted.

372.title: Success in industry is how long you can hold breath underwater: Sonu
372.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood has stated that success in the film industry is how long you can hold your breath underwater. He added that the wait to get your due is endless, crushing and extremely demanding. "I have been trying to hold my breath all these years. Maybe now it's time to come up and say, 'Hey, I exist'," he said.

373.title: Cell to be formed to resolve issues of U'khand's migrant residents: CM
373.article_body: Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami met with the migrant residents of the state and said that a cell would be formed in Dehradun to solve their problems. "Through this cell, along with resolving the problems of the migrants, efforts will be made to implement their suggestions related to the interest of the state," he said.

374.title: Gujarat groom receives lemons as wedding gift amid rising prices
374.article_body: A groom in Gujarat's Rajkot was given lemons as a gift during a wedding ceremony by his friends and relatives amid rising prices of the commodity. Explaining the reason behind the gift, a relative said, "At this time, the prices of lemons in the state and...country have gone up a lot. There's a lot of need for lemons this season."

375.title: Hardik has ticked all boxes with his performance in IPL so far: Jaffer
375.article_body: Wasim Jaffer said GT captain Hardik Pandya has answered all the questions regarding his form and fitness by ticking all the boxes with his performance in the ongoing IPL so far. "Among all...captains that have led for the first time, Hardik has impressed me the most," he added. Hardik has scored 228 runs and taken four wickets in five matches.

376.title: Migrant shot dead while crossing into Greece from Turkey: Police
376.article_body: A migrant was shot dead at the border on Saturday while attempting to enter Greece from Turkey on an inflatable dinghy, the Greek Police said on Sunday. However, it wasn't immediately clear who fired the shot that killed the woman. A Greek police officer claimed that a "barrage" of shots was fired from the Turkish side.

377.title: BCCI aims to start women's IPL with 6 teams next year: Report
377.article_body: BCCI is reportedly planning to start women's Indian Premier League (IPL) from next year and it is expected to feature six teams. "We have already started working on the plan as to how many teams we can have and what window is going to suit, because we have the men's IPL as well," said a BCCI source.

378.title: K'taka woman kills 6-month-old son, hangs self after husband dies
378.article_body: A 30-year old woman in Karnataka's Mangaluru allegedly killed her six-month-old son by strangulating him with a saree before hanging herself to death. The woman, who was staying at her brother's house, reportedly took this step after learning about her husband's sudden death. According to police, her 36-year-old husband died after being hit by an SUV while crossing a road.

379.title: AAP must clarify if it supports UK MP's anti-India views: BJP leader
379.article_body: BJP leader and ex-Army chief JJ Singh said Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) must clarify if it supports the "pro-separatist and anti-India" views of British Labour Party MP Tanmanjeet Singh Dhesi. This comes after Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann and AAP Rajya Sabha MP Raghav Chadha met Dhesi on Friday. Singh added that Mann must disclose what transpired during their meeting.

380.title: Maha farmer killed by tiger while watering crops in his farm
380.article_body: A 67-year-old farmer in Maharashtra's Chandrapur district was mauled to death by a tiger after he went to his farm to water his crops. The incident took place in the Brahmapuri forest division on Saturday. The farmer was dragged over a distance of 200 metres by the tiger and his body was found near the Wainganga river, an official said.

381.title: Sri Lankan protesters demand justice for victims of 2019 attacks
381.article_body: A group of protesters in Sri Lanka on Sunday demanded justice for the victims of the suicide bombings on Easter Sunday in 2019. The protesters lit candles and displayed banners and placards during a silent protest in the capital, Colombo. The protesters demanded the government uncover what they called the real conspirators behind the attacks.

382.title: Delhi records over 500 new COVID-19 cases, positivity rate at 4.21%
382.article_body: Delhi on Sunday reported 517 fresh COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, as compared to 461 cases recorded in the national capital on Saturday. The city also saw 261 COVID-19 recoveries and zero related deaths in the last 24 hours. The city's positivity rate on Sunday was at 4.21% as compared to 5.33% on Saturday.

383.title: Either I can’t sleep or I sleep for 10-12 hrs: Sonam on pregnancy
383.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor, speaking about her pregnancy, has said that it has been "very tough" for her. "Your body changes every week, every day, and there are new experiences," she stated. Sonam further said, "Sometimes I can't sleep because I am running to the loo or I'm like sleeping for 10-12 hours and nobody can wake me up."

384.title: FM Nirmala Sitharaman to travel to US on official visit tonight
384.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will embark on an official visit to the United States late tonight, the Ministry of Finance said on Sunday. During her visit, Sitharaman will attend the spring meetings of the IMF and the World Bank and the G20 Finance Ministers and Central Bank Governor meeting. She will also hold one-on-one meetings with CEOs of various companies.

385.title: Priority to curtail rumours: Delhi Police on Jahangirpuri violence
385.article_body: Special Commissioner of Police Dependra Pathak, while talking about the Jahangirpuri violence said that the police are on high alert and their priority is to "curtail rumours". "An adequate number of police officials are present at the location. So far, 20 accused have been arrested and two juveniles have been apprehended," Pathak further said.

386.title: Loved the violence: Shehnaaz Gill on 'KGF: Chapter 2'
386.article_body: Actress Shehnaaz Gill, taking to Twitter, praised actor Yash's 'KGF: Chapter 2' and wrote, "Congratulations, I love you all." She further wrote, "Loved the violence Yash. Peace out." Shehnaaz then congratulated Srinidhi Shetty, Sanjay Dutt, Raveena Tandon and the film's director Prashanth Neel. Yash replied to Shehnaaz's tweet and commented, "Thank you."

387.title: Vital that friends stick together amid threats to peace: UK PM ahead of India visit
387.article_body: Ahead of his visit to India on April 21, UK PM Boris Johnson tweeted, "As we face threats to our peace and prosperity from autocratic states, it is vital that democracies and friends stick together." The visit is aimed at deepening "the long-term partnership between our countries", Johnson said, adding, "India...is a highly valued strategic partner for the UK."

388.title: Would've been fun: Josh on almost playing Batman in Snyder's film
388.article_body: Actor Josh Brolin, talking about almost playing DC superhero Batman in Zack Snyder's 'Batman v Superman', said wanted to do the role, however, Snyder didn't see him fit for the role. "That was his decision...Honestly, that would have been a fun deal, and maybe I'll do it when I'm 80," he stated. Josh played Thanos in the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

389.title: Akshay has magnetic personality & an amazing aura: Magician Rahul
389.article_body: Magician Rahul Kharbanda, who taught illusions to actor Akshay Kumar in 'Atrangi Re', has said, "It's been one of the unforgettable experiences of my magic career." "Akshay has a magnetic personality and an amazing aura," he added. Rahul further said that Akshay was "very quick on adapting most of the props and executed them with finesse".

390.title: More would be injured had we not intervened: Policeman on Delhi violence
390.article_body: Sub-inspector of Police Meda Lal Meena, who sustained a bullet injury during the Jahangirpuri violence, said that more people would've been injured had police not intervened. He said that the rally were shouting 'Jai Shri Ram' when they reached the C block mosque. Meena added that the officers had to intervene to stop the fighting groups.

391.title: Spain seizes 3 tonnes of cocaine from fishing boat off Canary Islands
391.article_body: The Spanish Police said that they've seized nearly three tonnes of cocaine from a fishing boat off the Canary Islands. Five crew members, four Turkish citizens and one person from the ex-Soviet republic of Georgia, were arrested. The street value of the cocaine was estimated to be 72 million euros, which had been hidden in one of the fuel tanks.

392.title: WHO chief Tedros to be on 3-day Gujarat visit from tomorrow
392.article_body: Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, the Director-General of the World Health Organization (WHO), will be on a three-day visit to Gujarat starting Monday. During his visit, he would take part in a few events along with PM Narendra Modi, officials said. He'll join the PM on Tuesday in Jamnagar for the foundation stone-laying programme of the WHO Global Centre for Traditional Medicine.

393.title: It has consistently been the dysfunction of the company: Dorsey on Twitter board
393.article_body: Twitter Co-founder and former CEO Jack Dorsey said Twitter's board has "consistently been the dysfunction of the company". He was replying to a tweet that said the company's board has been "mired in plots and coups...particularly amongst Twitter's founding members". On being further asked if he is allowed to say this, Dorsey replied, "No."

394.title: PBKS are playing an entertaining brand of cricket in IPL 2022: Jaffer
394.article_body: Wasim Jaffer said PBKS are playing the most aggressive and entertaining cricket in IPL 2022, adding they end up scoring 190 even if they keep losing wickets. "But, if they don't lose wickets...play their brand of cricket, then you might see...totals of 220-225 posted by them," he added. PBKS were bowled out for 151 in 20 overs against SRH today.

395.title: 3-yr-old Shahid said he loves me as much as God loves man: Pankaj
395.article_body: Veteran actor Pankaj Kapur appeared on 'The Kapil Sharma Show' along with his son Shahid Kapoor, saying that Shahid was philosophical ever since he was young. "He was around 3-3.5 years old...he said 'Baba do you know how much I love you?...Jitna Khuda apne bando se karta hai (As much as God loves his children)'," the actor said.

396.title: Massive fire at Haryana chemical plant, firefighters from Delhi called in
396.article_body:
A massive fire broke out at a chemical factory in the Kundli area in Haryana's Sonipat on Sunday.
The Delhi Fire Service has also sent its firefighters to the spot for the operation on a special request from the Haryana government. The cause of the fire is not yet known, the Delhi Fire Service said.

397.title: Haven't thought that far but T20 WC remains at back of my mind: KKR's Umesh
397.article_body: KKR pacer Umesh Yadav, who has taken 10 wickets from six matches in IPL 2022, said he hasn't been thinking far ahead but 2022 T20 World Cup remains at the back of his mind. "It'll all depend on the selectors and the team management...but as a cricketer, I set small goals and try to achieve those in phases," he added.

398.title: Corruption and Congress are synonyms: BJP chief JP Nadda
398.article_body: BJP President Jagat Prakash Nadda on Sunday said corruption and Congress are synonyms. "Where there is BJP, there is a mission; where there is Congress, there is a commission," Nadda said while speaking at the Karyakarta Samavesh in Karnataka. "Even under adverse conditions, India is ready to make economic leaps under Prime Minister Narendra Modi's leadership," he added.

399.title: Death toll from flooding in South Africa rises to 443
399.article_body: The death toll from flooding in South Africa's KwaZulu-Natal province rose to 443, the provincial Premier said on Sunday. At least 63 people are missing, Sihle Zikalala added. The floods have left thousands homeless, knocked out power and water services and disrupted operations at the port of Durban, one of Africa's busiest ports.

400.title: Russian Navy chief meets crew of sunken warship Moskva
400.article_body: The head of the Russian Navy, Admiral Nikolay Yevmenov, has met with the crew members of the sunken warship Moskva, Russia's Defence Ministry said on Saturday. The crew would continue to serve in the Navy, it added. Ukraine said that its missile strike had sunk the flagship of Russia's Black Sea fleet, a claim that was not confirmed by Russia.

401.title: BJP govt ruined health services in UP, poor dying: Akhilesh
401.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Sunday accused the ruling BJP of "ruining" the health services in Uttar Pradesh, alleging that the poor are "dying" due to lack of treatment. "People were orphaned during the COVID-19 pandemic. Even today, there is no sign of improvement and chaos is prevailing," he alleged.
